Schema definition (ODD) for the critical apparatus (crApp) of Baumann-Digital (BauDi)

Author: Dennis Ried2023-03-30

Table of contents

  • 1. Vorwort
    • 1.1. Pr√§ambel

    • Appendix A.5 Constraints

1. Vorwort

1.1. Pr√§ambel

Das crApp-Framework ist im Rahmen meines Dissertationsprojektes zu hybriden Musikeditionen entstanden. Das Dedsiderat, dem ich mich gegen√ºbersah war die Handhabung von kritischen Berichten in digitalen Umgebungen, die sich sowohl technisch als auch inhaltlich nahezu nicht vom analogen Pendant unterschied, obwohl die Rahmenbedingungen und M√∂glichkeiten digitaler Medien grundlegend andere sind, als im gedruckten Pendant.

Bei der Untersuchen des Grades der Digitalit√§t hybrider Musikeditionen r√ºckte der kritische Bericht deshalb ins Zentrum der Betrachtung, da hier das gr√∂√üte Defizit vorgefunden wurde. Dies einfach nur festzustellen h√§tte vermutlich nichts gebracht, da dieser Aspekt seit etwa 15 Jahren trotz kritischer Anmerkungen nicht einmal im Ansatz weiterentwickelt wurde. Daher wird mit dem critical apparatus-Framework (crApp) ein erster Vorschlag eingebracht, wie kritische Berichte in hybriden Musikeditionen digitaler und damit zeitgem√§√üer gestaltet werden k√∂nnten.

Ich bezeichne dieses System ‚Äì damit meine ich sowohl das Datenschema als auch die WebApp ‚Äì bewusst als Vorschlag, denn es stellt lediglich eine denkbare M√∂glichkeit dar, wie dem angesprochenen Desiderat begegnet werden kann. Dar√ºber hinaus steckt dieses System regelrecht in den Kinderschuhen, da sich Datenmodelle und visualisierende bzw. auswertende Software bekanntlich mit der Zeit verfertigen; konkret durch den Gebrauch in unterschiedlichen Kontexten mit verschiedenartigen Forschungsobjekten.

Waldsee, 14. Juli 2023
Dennis Ried

2. Das Datenmodell

2.1. Verwendete Schemata

Das Datenmodell ist stark an MEI angelehnt, stellt jedoch nicht die Codierung von Quellen oder Werken in den Mittelpunkt. Die aus MEI entlehnten Elemente sind daher mehr oder weniger stark modifiziert worden, um sie in das neue Anwendungsfeld einzupassen. Elemente, die nicht dem MEI-Standard entspringen, wurden f√ºr diesen Anwendungszweck neu definiert.

Innerhalb des crApp-Schemas befinden sich alle Elemente im crApp-Namspace. Eine Unterscheidung in crApp und MEI mittels Pr√§fixierung hat sich als untauglich erwiesen.

2.2.

Das crApp-Schema ist in drei Module gegliedert

Modul NameFormeller IdentifikatorDefinition und Erl√§uterung
coreCommon Core2.5. Datentypen, Klassen, Macros (core)
remarkRemark and Annotation2.4. Kritische Anmerkungen (remark)
settingCommon Setting2.3. Grundparameter (setting)

2.3. Grundparameter (setting)

F√ºr die systematische Erfassung kritischer Anmerkungen sind Grundparameter zu definieren: Welche Quellen sind verf√ºgbar? Welche Instrumente sind beteiligt? Wird auf Editionen referenziert? Und vieles mehr. Die Definition dieser Aspekte erfolgt im Element <setting>.

Ferner werden hier die M√∂glichkeiten und Kontrollmechanismen f√ºr die sp√§tere Kodierung festgelegt.

  • setting (setting) Records the setting of the described work.

Bei dem Element <setting> handelt es sich um einen Container, der s√§mtliche Defintionen f√ºr den zu erfassenden Kritischen Bericht enth√§lt. Dieses Element dient allein zur Definition der Infrastruktur.

Die Verwendung von <setting> als Wurzelelement ist erlaubt, um die Auslagerung und damit die Nachnutzung einer Definition in mehreren Werkkontexten zu gew√§hrleisten. Wird dieser Teil ausgelagert, kann das Setting durch XInclude in die Kritischen Berichte inkludiert werden: 

<include xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" href="setting.xml">‚öì

2.3.1. Musikalische Struktur

  • language (language) Defines the main language used.
  • macro.list.lang (Supported languages) Supported languages at crApp-WebApp.

Zu beginn wird die prim√§re Sprache definiert, in der die Anmerkungen verfasst sind. Diese wird durch den Wert im Attribut codedval erfasst. Die unterst√ºtzen Sprachen sind im Macro macro.list.lang erfasst. Das Schema l√§sst nur diese Sprachen zu, da die crApp-WebApp nur ebendiese Sprachen unterst√ºtzt. Eine Erweiterung des Macros f√ºr individuelle Zwecke ist m√∂glich und erw√ºnscht. F√ºr die Implementierung der neuen Sprache in die crApp-WebApp wenden Sie sich gerne auch an ried-musikforschung@mail.com

  • mdiv (musical division) Defines a musical devision of a work
    num [att.numbering](number) Attribute for numbering. The value must be an integer.
    sortNo [att.numbering](sorting number) Attribute for sorting purpose. The value must be an integer.
  • mdivs (musical divisions) Container for <mdiv> elements.

Das an MEI angelehnte Element <mdiv> steht f√ºr einen musikalischen Abschnitt (musical division). Dieses Element ist generisch angelegt und kann sowohl die S√§tze eines Werkes definieren, als auch Werke (bspw. Lieder), Werke oder Teile einer Sammlung, Nummern einer Oper oder sonstige Strukturen. Die Numerierung der <mdiv> Elemente mit dem Atttribut num ist obligatorisch und als eine technische Z√§hlung zu betrachten. Das hei√üt, dass eine Nummerierung auch dann vergeben werden muss, wenn die einzelnen Abschnitte im beschriebene Objekt nicht nummeriert sind. Als Werte sind ausschlie√ülich Nat√ºrliche Zahlen (inkl. 0) erlaubt. Diese Z√§hlung ist f√ºr die sp√§tere Zuordnung und Sortierung ma√ügeblich; daher ist die Verwendung arabischer Ziffern vorgegeben.

Um dem <mdiv> einen Bezeichner beizugeben, wird das Element <label> unter Angabe der verwendeten Sprache (xml:lang) verwendet:

<mdiv¬†num="1"> ¬†<label¬†xml:lang="de">I. M√§nnerchor</label> </mdiv>

Das Element <mdivs> ist ein Container f√ºr <mdiv> Elemente.

2.3.2. Instrumentation und Besetzung

  • parts (parts) Container for <partGrp> and <part> elements.
  • partGrp (part group) Defines a part group.
  • part (part) Defines an instrumental or vocal part of the work.

Die Instrumentation kann √§u√üerst komplex gestaltet sein. Daher bietet das crApp-Schema die M√∂glichkeit, dass einzelne Stimmen zu Gruppen zusammengefasst werden. Das Element <parts> ist hier wieder ein Container, der die Definition der Instrumentation enth√§lt, egal wie diese organisiert ist.

Das Element <partGrp> ist ein Wrapper, der nicht nur zur Gruppierung verwendet wird, sondern gleizeitig auch eine Gruppe von Einzelstimmen definiert. Dies l√§sst sich auf beliebig vielen Ebenen umsetzen, wie das folgende Beispiel zeigt.

<parts> ¬†<partGrp¬†xml:id="woods"> ¬†¬†<label¬†xml:lang="de">Holz</label> ¬†¬†<label¬†xml:lang="en">Woods</label> ¬†¬†<partGrp¬†xml:id="flutes"> ¬†¬†¬†<label¬†xml:lang="de">Fl√∂ten</label> ¬†¬†¬†<label¬†xml:lang="en">Flutes</label> ¬†¬†¬†<part¬†xml:id="flute.i"> ¬†¬†¬†¬†<label¬†xml:lang="de">Fl√∂te I</label> ¬†¬†¬†¬†<label¬†xml:lang="en">1st Flute</label> ¬†¬†¬†</part> ¬†¬†¬†<part¬†xml:id="flute.ii"> ¬†¬†¬†¬†<label¬†xml:lang="de">Fl√∂te II</label> ¬†¬†¬†¬†<label¬†xml:lang="en">2nd Flute</label> ¬†¬†¬†</part> ¬†¬†</partGrp> ¬†</partGrp> </parts>

Der verwendete Wert im Atttribut xml:id muss eindeutig sein, da hier√ºber die Zuordnung der Anmerkungen zu den betroffenen Stimmen hergestellt wird. Es empfielt sich die Werte wie im vorangegangenen Beispiel generisch zu w√§hlen unter Vermeidung von Umlauten und Leerzeichen, um technischen Problemen vorzubeugen.

Mit der Definition einer Gruppierung (bspw. Stimmgruppe Holz) wird das Ansteuern der Gruppe m√∂glich, ohne dass jede Stimme einzeln verlinkt werden muss.

Die im vorigen Beispiel abgebildete Komplexit√§t der Verschachtelung kann durch das Schema validiert werden. Eine Schematron-Regel pr√ºft, ob die in der Anmerkung als Partizipatoren angegebenen Stimmen bereits durch eine Gruppe aufgerufen wurden und warnt vor Redundanzen.

2.3.3. Assoziierte Werke (related works)

  • relWork (related Work) Defines a work.

Mit <relWork> erfolgt die Zuordnung des Kritischen Berichts zu einem Werk. Dies kann mittels ID-Verweis geschehen (key) oder √ºber einen expliziten Dateipfad, der im Attribut target erfasst wird; abh√§ngig von Zweck, den die Zuordnung verfolgen soll bzw. nach Kontext in den die Kritischen Anmekrungen eingebunden werden.

Sind die erfassten Anmerkungen f√ºr die Weiterverwendung in der crApp-Applikation vorgesehen, so ist es ausreichend, wenn die Referenzierung √ºber das Attribut key erfolgt. Es wird vorausgesetzt, dass sich die Referenzdatens√§tze in der selben Datenbank befinden in der die Applikation installiert ist.

Im Falle, dass der Pfad zum Referenzdatensatz an einen anderen Ort zeigen soll, kann der entsprechende Pfad als Wert von target eingegeben werden. Dies bietet sich beispielsweise dann an, wenn lokale Transformationen durchgef√ºhrt werden, bei denen eine Ansprache √ºber eine ID zu gro√üe Hardware-Kapazit√§ten erfordern w√ºrden.

  • measures (measures) Records the Count of measures of a work.
    total
    upbeat
    startNo
  • meter Captures information about the time signature within bibliographic descriptions.
    count [att.meterSig.log]Captures the number of beats in a measure, that is, the top number of the meter signature. It must contain a decimal number or an expression that evaluates to a decimal number, such as 2+3 or 3*2.
    unit [att.meterSig.log]Contains the number indicating the beat unit, that is, the bottom number of the meter signature.

Mit der Erfassung statistischer Werte zu den Takten (<measures>) des Werkes, k√∂nnen weitere Validierungen aktiviert werden. So kann neben der Gesamtzahl der Takte (total) auch die Existenz von Auftakten (upbeat) und die erste Taktzahl (total), falls abweichend (z.B. 0) erfasst werden. Die Gesamtzahl der Takte wird f√ºr die Validierung der in den Anmerkungen angegebenen Taktzahlen verwendet. Versucht man eine Anmerkung zu einem Takt zu erfassen, der au√üerhalb des Werkes/Satzes liegt, so wird ein Fehler ausgegeben.

Die Erfassung des Metrums (<meter>) erfolgt, wie in MEI, mittels der Attribute count f√ºr den Z√§hler und unit f√ºr den Nenner. Mithilfe dieser Werte, werden die Z√§hlzeiten in den Anmerkungen validiert.1

2.3.4. Assoziierte Quellen (related sources)

  • manifestationList A container for the descriptions of physical embodiments of an expression of a work.
  • manifestation A bibliographic description of a physical embodiment of an expression of a work.

Die Referenzierung von Refernzdatens√§tzen zu Quellen erfolgt analog zu 2.3.3. Assoziierte Werke (related works).

Im Vergleich zu <relWork> weist das Element <manifestation> eine Erweiterung auf: Das Attribut sortNo kann daf√ºr verwendet werden, um eine Reihenfolge f√ºr die Anzeigereihenfolge der Quellen in der crApp-Applikaiton festzulegen.2

<manifestationList> ¬†<manifestation¬†sortNo="1"¬†xml:id="A-P1"> ¬†¬†<label¬†xml:lang="de">Handschriftliche Partitur (Vorspiel)</label> ¬†¬†<label¬†xml:lang="en">Handwritten score (prelude)</label> ¬†</manifestation> </manifestationList>

2.3.5. Assoziierte Editionen (related editions)

  • edition (edition) Defines an edition or a part of an edition.
  • relEditions (related editions) Defines editions related to the critcal apparatus.

Diese Elemente sind von 2.3.4. Assoziierte Quellen (related sources) abgeleitet und verhalten sich analog.

2.3.6. Klassifikationen

  • classifications (classifications) Container to organize classifications.
  • classGrp (class Group) Container for class definitions.
  • class (class) Defines a class or category to be used for classifying.

Klassifikationen sind f√ºr die Erfassung strukturierter Daten unabdingbar.

<classifications> ¬†<classGrp¬†label="editorialClassifications"> ¬†¬†<class¬†xml:id="noStart"> ¬†¬†¬†<label¬†xml:lang="de">Nur beginnend</label> ¬†¬†¬†<label¬†xml:lang="en">Only initiating</label> ¬†¬†</class> ¬†¬†<class¬†xml:id="noEnd"> ¬†¬†¬†<label¬†xml:lang="de">Nur endend</label> ¬†¬†¬†<label¬†xml:lang="en">Only terminating</label> ¬†¬†</class> ¬†¬†<class¬†xml:id="without"> ¬†¬†¬†<label¬†xml:lang="de">ohne</label> ¬†¬†¬†<label¬†xml:lang="en">without</label> ¬†¬†</class> ¬†¬†<class¬†xml:id="ediAdd"> ¬†¬†¬†<label¬†xml:lang="de">Hinzuf√ºgung</label> ¬†¬†¬†<label¬†xml:lang="en">Addition</label> ¬†¬†</class> ¬†¬†<class¬†xml:id="ediDel"> ¬†¬†¬†<label¬†xml:lang="de">Tilgung</label> ¬†¬†¬†<label¬†xml:lang="en">Deletion</label> ¬†¬†</class> ¬†</classGrp> </classifications>

Im angef√ºhrten Beispiel wird eine Klassifikationsgruppe gezeigt, welche die Arten von Anmerkungen definiert. Es k√∂nnen beliebig viele <classGrp>s definiert werden, die wiederum beliebig viele <class> Elemente enthalten k√∂nnen.

2.3.7. Schreibmittel und Schreiber

  • handList Container for one or more hand elements.
  • hand Defines a distinct scribe or handwriting style.
    cert [att.evidence]Signifies the degree of certainty or precision associated with a feature.
    initialMarks this hand as the first one of the document.
    medium [att.medium]Describes the writing medium.

Im Container <handList> k√∂nnnen die einzelnen Schreibmittel, Schreibstile und Schreibende erfasst werden.

<handList> ¬†<hand¬†xml:id="hand.1"¬†medium="ink.black" ¬†¬†initial="true"> ¬†¬†<name>Ludwig Baumann</name> ¬†</hand> </handList>

Die Angabe der Attribute cert, initial und medium sind ebenso optional wie die Angbae eines Schreibenden (im Beispiel: Ludwig Baumann).

2.4. Kritische Anmerkungen (remark)

  • remarks (remarks) Container for <remark> elements.
  • remark (critical remark) A critical remark relating to an edition.
    type

Der Container <remarks> beinhaltet die Kritischen Anmerkungen. Das Element <remark> stellt die Einzelanmerkung dar.

<remark¬†type="editorial" ¬†xml:id="baudi-30-60dcfc3b"> ¬†<class>Tempoangabe</class> ¬†<mdiv>0</mdiv> ¬†<occurances> ¬†¬†<occurance> ¬†¬†¬†<position¬†measure="1"¬†count="1"/> ¬†¬†</occurance> ¬†</occurances> ¬†<parts> ¬†¬†<part>organ.right</part> ¬†</parts> ¬†<annots> ¬†¬†<annot> ¬†¬†¬†<tempo¬†class="#without"/> ¬†¬†</annot> ¬†</annots> ¬†<manifestationList> ¬†¬†<manifestation>ED-KA1</manifestation> ¬†¬†<manifestation>ED-KA2</manifestation> ¬†</manifestationList> ¬†<editionList> ¬†¬†<edition>BauDi-Harm</edition> ¬†¬†<edition>BauDi-KA</edition> ¬†</editionList> </remark>
  • class (class) Defines a class or category to be used for classifying.

Das Element <class> dient der Klassifizierung. Die Werte, die als Text eingegeben werden k√∂nnen, sind in <setting> in der Klassifizierung definiert. Wird ein Wert eingegeben, der zuvor nicht definiert wurde wirft die Schematron-Validierung einen Fehler aus.

  • mdiv (musical division) Defines a musical devision of a work

√úber <mdiv> erfolgt eine Zuordnung zu dem musikalischen Abschnitt, in dem die Anmerkung vorkommt. F√ºr den eher seltenen Fall, dass eine Anmerkung sich auf mehrere S√§tze bezieht (bspw. bei einer Parallelstelle, die in einem anderen Satz in Erscheinung tritt), k√∂nnen mehrere <mdiv> Elemente verwendet werden. In diesem Falle wird von der Schematron-Validierung eine Information angezeigt, dass dieses Verfahren m√∂glich jedoch eher un√ºblich ist. Ein Validierungsfehler wird dadurch nicht verursacht. Im Gegensatz dazu kann auf <mdiv> verzichtet werden, wenn es sich um eine Generalanmerkung handelt, die f√ºr das gesamte Werk oder eine einzelne Quelle gilt.

  • occurances (occurances) Container for <occurance> elements.
  • occurance (occurance) Defines a place in the musical structure, represented by a position or range.
  • position (measure position) Defines a position in the metrical structure.
    count [att.timing]An attribute for defining a count as a time stamp. The value must be a positive integer.
    measure [att.timing]An attribute for defining a measure as a time stamp. The value must be a positive integer.

Das Element <occurances> ist ein Wrapper und verzeichnet diejenigen Stellen, an denen besagte Anmerkung von Relevanz ist. Da es durchaus sein kann, dass eine Anmerkung des √∂fteren von Relevanz ist (bspw. in den Takten 2,4,5 und 8 enden die B√∂gen bereits eine Achtel fr√ºher), ist es auch m√∂glich das Element <occurance> mehrfach zu verwenden. Ziel dieser Kodierung ist es, dass ein und diesselbe Anmerkung, die f√ºr mehrere Stellen gilt nicht mehrfach geschrieben wird, sondern die einzelnen Stellen dem Befund zugeordnet werden.

Die Stelle kann auf zwei verschiedene Arten identidiziert werden: als Stelle (<position>) oder als Bereich. Im ersten Fall handelt es sich um ein Vorkommen dessen Position sich durch eine Taktzahl und ggf. durch eine Z√§hlzeit angeben l√§sst. Eine Schema-basierte Validierung von Taktzahlen und Z√§hlzeiten ist derzeit nicht verf√ºgbar, da eine Erfassung der Taktstruktur sowie des m√∂glicherweise wechselnden Metrums zur Zeit nicht vorgesehen ist. Es ist allerdings denkbar, dass diese Struktur sp√§ter √ºber die referenzierten Quellen eingebunden werden k√∂nnte.

<occurance> ¬†<position¬†measure="2"¬†count="3"/> </occurance>

Betrifft die Anmerkung nicht eine einzelne Position, sondern einen Bereich (bspw. Takt 1 Z√§hlzeit 1 bis Takt 3 Z√§hlzeit 4 ohne Dynamikangaben) kann dieser ebenfalls √ºber das Element <position> unter Verwendung des Attributes type (Werte start/end) erfasst werden.

<occurance> ¬†<range¬†type="start"¬†measure="6"¬†count="1"/> ¬†<range¬†type="end"¬†measure="7"¬†count="1"/> </occurance>

[‚Ä¶]

  • parts (parts) Container for <partGrp> and <part> elements.

[‚Ä¶]

  • annots (annotations) Container for <annot> elements.

[‚Ä¶]

  • manifestationList A container for the descriptions of physical embodiments of an expression of a work.
  • editionList (edition list) Container for <edition> Elements.

[‚Ä¶]

2.5. Datentypen, Klassen, Macros (core)

[‚Ä¶]

Appendix A Specifications of the crApp schema

Appendix A.1 Elements

Appendix A.1.1 <abbr>

<abbr> (abbreviation) A generic element for 1) a shortened form of a word, including an acronym or 2) a shorthand notation.
Namespacehttp://www.music-encoding.org/ns/mei
ModuleMEI.edittrans
Attributesatt.common (att.basic (@xml:base) (att.id (@xml:id)) ) (att.labelled (@label)) (att.linking (@copyof, @corresp, @follows, @next, @precedes, @prev, @sameas, @synch)) (att.nNumberLike (@n)) (att.responsibility (@resp)) (att.typed (@type) (att.classed (@class)) ) att.edit (att.source (@source)) (att.evidence (@cert, @evidence)) att.lang (@xml:lang, @translit) att.trans (att.handIdent (@hand)) (att.metadataPointing (@decls)) (att.sequence (@seq))
expanRecords the expansion of a text abbreviation.
StatusOptional
Datatypestring
Member of
model.editorialLike
Contained by
MEI.cmn: attacca bracketSpan gliss octave
MEI.critapp: lem rdg

MEI.ptrref: ptr ref

MEI.text: q quote seg
MEI.usersymbols: anchoredText
character data
Note

In no case should <abbr> contain elements that would not otherwise be permitted to occur within the parent of its own <app> ancestor. For example, when used as a descendent of <verse>, <abbr> should only contain those elements allowed within <verse>.

Note

The model of this element is based on the abbr element of the Text Encoding Initiative (TEI) and the abbr element of the Encoded Archival Description (EAD).

      text

    |¬†model.editLike

Appendix A.1.2 <accid/>

<accid/> (accidental) Records a temporary alteration to the pitch of a note.
Namespacehttp://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0
ModuleMEI.shared
Attributesatt.common (att.basic (@xml:base) (att.id (@xml:id)) ) (att.labelled (@label)) (att.linking (@copyof, @corresp, @follows, @next, @precedes, @prev, @sameas, @synch)) (att.nNumberLike (@n)) (att.responsibility (@resp)) (att.typed (@type) (att.classed (@class)) ) att.accid.log (@func) (att.accidental (@accid)) (att.controlEvent (att.layerIdent (@layer)) (att.partIdent (@part, @partstaff)) (att.plist (@plist)) (att.staffIdent (@staff)) (att.targetEval (@evaluate)) (att.timestamp.log (@tstamp)) (att.timestamp.ges (@tstamp.ges, @tstamp.real)) ) att.accid.vis (att.altSym (@altsym)) (att.color (@color)) (att.enclosingChars (@enclose)) (att.placementOnStaff (@onstaff)) (att.placementRelEvent (@place)) (att.staffLoc (@loc)) (att.staffLoc.pitched (@ploc, @oloc)) (att.typography (@fontfam, @fontname, @fontsize, @fontstyle, @fontweight, @letterspacing, @lineheight)) (att.visualOffset.ho (@ho)) (att.visualOffset.vo (@vo)) (att.xy (@x, @y)) att.accid.ges (att.accidental.ges (@accid.ges)) att.accid.anl
Member of
macro.annot.content model.noteModifierLike
Contained by
MEI.cmn: oLayer
MEI.critapp: lem rdg
MEI.edittrans: abbr add corr damage del expan orig reg sic supplied unclear
MEI.shared: layer note
remark: annot
May containEmpty element
Note

An accidental may raise a pitch by one or two semitones or it may cancel a previous accidental or part of a key signature. This element provides an alternative to the accid and accid.ges attributes on the <note> element. The element may be used when specific display info, such as size or color, needs to be recorded for the accidental or when multiple accidentals occur on a single note. The func attribute can be used to differentiate between the accidental‚Äôs functions, such as 'cautionary' or 'editorial'.

Content model
<content¬†autoPrefix="true">
</content>
    ‚öì
Schema Declaration
element accid
{
   att.common.attributes,
   att.accid.log.attributes,
   att.accid.vis.attributes,
   att.accid.ges.attributes,
   att.accid.anl.attributes,
   empty
}‚öì

Appendix A.1.3 <add>

<add> (addition) Marks an addition to the text.
Namespacehttp://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0
ModuleMEI.edittrans
Attributesatt.common (att.basic (@xml:base) (att.id (@xml:id)) ) (att.labelled (@label)) (att.linking (@copyof, @corresp, @follows, @next, @precedes, @prev, @sameas, @synch)) (att.nNumberLike (@n)) (att.responsibility (@resp)) (att.typed (@type) (att.classed (@class)) ) att.edit (att.source (@source)) (att.evidence (@cert, @evidence)) att.extent (@extent) (att.measurement (@unit)) (att.ranging (@atleast, @atmost, @min, @max, @confidence)) att.lang (@xml:lang, @translit) att.trans (att.handIdent (@hand)) (att.metadataPointing (@decls)) (att.sequence (@seq))
placeLocation of the addition.
StatusOptional
Datatype1‚Äì‚àû occurrences of¬† separated by whitespace
Member of
macro.annot.content model.transcriptionLike
Contained by
MEI.cmn: attacca beam graceGrp measure oLayer oStaff tuplet
MEI.critapp: lem rdg
MEI.edittrans: abbr add corr damage del expan orig reg sic subst supplied unclear
MEI.shared: chord dir dynam ending keySig label labelAbbr layer name note num ornam rend rest section staff syl tempo
MEI.text: quote seg
MEI.usersymbols: anchoredText
remark: annot
May contain
MEI.cmn: arpeg attacca bTrem beam beamSpan beatRpt bend bracketSpan breath fTrem fermata gliss graceGrp hairpin halfmRpt harpPedal lv mRest mRpt mRpt2 mSpace measure meterSig meterSigGrp multiRest multiRpt octave pedal reh slur tie tuplet tupletSpan
MEI.cmnOrnaments: trill
MEI.edittrans: abbr add choice corr damage del expan gap handShift orig reg sic subst supplied unclear
MEI.ptrref: ptr ref
MEI.shared: accid artic barLine caesura chord clef dir dot dynam ending keyAccid keySig layer lb lg name note num ornam pad pb rend rest sb scoreDef section space staff staffDef staffGrp syl tempo
MEI.text: q quote seg
MEI.usersymbols: anchoredText
character data
Note

The <add> element contains material inserted by an author, scribe, annotator, or corrector. The agent responsible for the addition may be encoded using the hand attribute, while the resp attribute records the editor or transcriber responsible for identifying the hand of the addition. The cert attribute signifies the degree of certainty ascribed to the identification of the hand of the addition. The editor(s) responsible for asserting this particular reading may be recorded in the resp attribute. The value of resp must point to one or more identifiers declared in the document header.

In no case should <add> contain elements that would not otherwise be permitted to occur within the parent of its own <app> ancestor. For example, when used as a descendent of <verse>, <add> should only contain those elements allowed within <verse>.

Note

The model of this element is based on the add element of the Text Encoding Initiative (TEI).

Content model
<content¬†autoPrefix="true">
</content>
    ‚öì
Schema Declaration
element add
{
   att.common.attributes,
   att.edit.attributes,
   att.extent.attributes,
   att.lang.attributes,
   att.trans.attributes,
   attribute [http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0]place { list { data.PLACEMENT+ } }?,
   (
      text
    |¬†model.divLike
    |¬†model.editLike
    |¬†model.editTransPart
    |¬†model.fLike
    |¬†model.graphicPrimitiveLike
    |¬†model.keyAccidLike
    |¬†model.layerPart
    |¬†model.milestoneLike.music
    |¬†model.sectionPart
    |¬†model.staffGrpLike
    |¬†model.transcriptionLike
   )*
}‚öì

Appendix A.1.4 <anchoredText>

<anchoredText> Container for text that is fixed to a particular page location, regardless of changes made to the layout of the measures around it.
Namespacehttp://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0
ModuleMEI.usersymbols
Attributesatt.common (att.basic (@xml:base) (att.id (@xml:id)) ) (att.labelled (@label)) (att.linking (@copyof, @corresp, @follows, @next, @precedes, @prev, @sameas, @synch)) (att.nNumberLike (@n)) (att.responsibility (@resp)) (att.typed (@type) (att.classed (@class)) ) att.lang (@xml:lang, @translit) att.anchoredText.anlatt.anchoredText.gesatt.anchoredText.log (@func) (att.startId (@startid)) att.anchoredText.vis (att.visualOffset (att.visualOffset.ho (@ho)) (att.visualOffset.to (@to)) (att.visualOffset.vo (@vo)) ) (att.xy (@x, @y))
Member of
macro.annot.content model.graphicPrimitiveLike
Contained by
MEI.cmn: attacca measure oLayer oStaff
MEI.critapp: lem rdg
MEI.edittrans: abbr add corr damage del expan orig reg sic supplied unclear
MEI.shared: dir ending layer ornam section staff tempo
remark: annot
May contain
MEI.edittrans: abbr add choice corr damage del expan gap handShift orig reg sic subst supplied unclear
MEI.ptrref: ptr ref
MEI.shared: lb name num rend
MEI.text: q seg
character data
Note

This element may be used where semantic markup of the text is neither possible nor desirable, such as in optical music recognition (OMR) applications. The content model here is similar to paragraph without model.textcomponent and <pb> sub-elements. The starting point of the text may be identified in absolute output coordinate terms using the x and y attributes or relative to the location of another element using the startid attribute. The attributes in the att.visualOffset class may be used to record horizontal, vertical, or time offsets from the absolute coordinates or from the location of the referenced element.

Content model
<content¬†autoPrefix="true">
</content>
    ‚öì
Schema Declaration
element anchoredText
{
   att.common.attributes,
   att.lang.attributes,
   att.anchoredText.anl.attributes,
   att.anchoredText.ges.attributes,
   att.anchoredText.log.attributes,
   att.anchoredText.vis.attributes,
   (
      text
    |¬†model.textPhraseLike.limited
    |¬†model.editLike
    |¬†model.transcriptionLike
   )*
}‚öì

(editorial intervention)

(finding)

Appendix A.1.7 <app>

<app> (apparatus) ‚Äì Contains one or more alternative encodings.
Namespacehttp://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0
ModuleMEI.critapp
Attributesatt.common (att.basic (@xml:base) (att.id (@xml:id)) ) (att.labelled (@label)) (att.linking (@copyof, @corresp, @follows, @next, @precedes, @prev, @sameas, @synch)) (att.nNumberLike (@n)) (att.responsibility (@resp)) (att.typed (@type) (att.classed (@class)) )
Member of
macro.annot.content model.appLike
Contained by
MEI.cmn: beam graceGrp measure oLayer oStaff tuplet
MEI.critapp: lem rdg
MEI.shared: chord ending layer note rest section staff syl
remark: annot
May contain
MEI.critapp: lem rdg
Note

The alternatives provided in <lem> and/or <rdg> sub-elements may be thought of as exclusive or as parallel. The type attribute may contain any convenient descriptive word, describing the extent of the variation (e.g., note, phrase, measure, etc.), its text-critical significance (e.g., significant, accidental, unclear), or the nature of the variation or the principles required to understand it (e.g., lectio difficilior, usus auctoris, etc.).

Note

The model of this element is based on the app element of the Text Encoding Initiative (TEI).

Content model
<content¬†autoPrefix="true">
</content>
    ‚öì
Schema Declaration
element app { att.common.attributes, lem?, rdg, rdg* }‚öì

Appendix A.1.8 <arpeg/>

<arpeg/> (arpeggiation) Indicates that the notes of a chord are to be performed successively rather than simultaneously, usually from lowest to highest. Sometimes called a "roll".
Namespacehttp://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0
ModuleMEI.cmn
Attributesatt.common (att.basic (@xml:base) (att.id (@xml:id)) ) (att.labelled (@label)) (att.linking (@copyof, @corresp, @follows, @next, @precedes, @prev, @sameas, @synch)) (att.nNumberLike (@n)) (att.responsibility (@resp)) (att.typed (@type) (att.classed (@class)) ) att.arpeg.log (@order) (att.controlEvent (att.layerIdent (@layer)) (att.partIdent (@part, @partstaff)) (att.plist (@plist)) (att.staffIdent (@staff)) (att.targetEval (@evaluate)) (att.timestamp.log (@tstamp)) (att.timestamp.ges (@tstamp.ges, @tstamp.real)) ) (att.startId (@startid)) att.arpeg.vis (@arrow, @arrow.shape, @arrow.size, @arrow.color, @arrow.fillcolor, @line.form, @line.width) (att.altSym (@altsym)) (att.color (@color)) (att.enclosingChars (@enclose)) (att.typography (@fontfam, @fontname, @fontsize, @fontstyle, @fontweight, @letterspacing, @lineheight)) (att.visualOffset (att.visualOffset.ho (@ho)) (att.visualOffset.to (@to)) (att.visualOffset.vo (@vo)) ) (att.xy (@x, @y)) att.arpeg.gesatt.arpeg.anl
Member of
model.controlEventLike.cmn
Contained by
MEI.cmn: measure
MEI.critapp: lem rdg
MEI.edittrans: abbr add corr damage del expan orig reg sic supplied unclear
May containEmpty element
Note

The modern arpeggiation symbol is a vertical wavy line preceding the chord. When the notes of the chord are to be performed from highest to lowest, an arrowhead may be added to the lower end of the line. Even though it is redundant, an arrowhead is sometimes added to the upper end of the line for the sake of consistency or when the direction of successive arpeggios alternates. In music for keyboard instruments, sometimes a distinction is made between a single arpeggio in which both hands play successively and simultaneous arpeggios in two hands. In the case of the former, multiple values may be required in the staff and layer attributes. Arpeggios that do not cross staves, but still involve more than one layer require multiple values for the layer attribute.

Content model
<content¬†autoPrefix="true">
</content>
    ‚öì
Schema Declaration
element arpeg
{
   att.common.attributes,
   att.arpeg.log.attributes,
   att.arpeg.vis.attributes,
   att.arpeg.ges.attributes,
   att.arpeg.anl.attributes,
   empty
}‚öì

Appendix A.1.9 <artic/>

<artic/> (articulation) An indication of how to play a note or chord.
Namespacehttp://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0
ModuleMEI.shared
Attributesatt.common (att.basic (@xml:base) (att.id (@xml:id)) ) (att.labelled (@label)) (att.linking (@copyof, @corresp, @follows, @next, @precedes, @prev, @sameas, @synch)) (att.nNumberLike (@n)) (att.responsibility (@resp)) (att.typed (@type) (att.classed (@class)) ) att.artic.log (att.articulation (@artic)) (att.controlEvent (att.layerIdent (@layer)) (att.partIdent (@part, @partstaff)) (att.plist (@plist)) (att.staffIdent (@staff)) (att.targetEval (@evaluate)) (att.timestamp.log (@tstamp)) (att.timestamp.ges (@tstamp.ges, @tstamp.real)) ) att.artic.vis (att.altSym (@altsym)) (att.color (@color)) (att.enclosingChars (@enclose)) (att.placementOnStaff (@onstaff)) (att.placementRelEvent (@place)) (att.staffLoc (@loc)) (att.staffLoc.pitched (@ploc, @oloc)) (att.typography (@fontfam, @fontname, @fontsize, @fontstyle, @fontweight, @letterspacing, @lineheight)) (att.visualOffset (att.visualOffset.ho (@ho)) (att.visualOffset.to (@to)) (att.visualOffset.vo (@vo)) ) (att.xy (@x, @y)) att.artic.ges (att.articulation.ges (@artic.ges)) att.artic.anl
Member of
macro.annot.content model.chordPart model.noteModifierLike
Contained by
MEI.cmn: oLayer
MEI.critapp: lem rdg
MEI.edittrans: abbr add corr damage del expan orig reg sic supplied unclear
MEI.shared: chord layer note
remark: annot
May containEmpty element
Note

Articulations typically affect duration, such as staccato marks, or the force of attack, such as accents. This element provides an alternative to the artic attribute on the <note> and <chord> elements. It may be used when specific display info, such as size or color, needs to be recorded for the articulation or when multiple articulation marks occur on a single note or chord.

Content model
<content¬†autoPrefix="true">
</content>
    ‚öì
Schema Declaration
element artic
{
   att.common.attributes,
   att.artic.log.attributes,
   att.artic.vis.attributes,
   att.artic.ges.attributes,
   att.artic.anl.attributes,
   empty
}‚öì

Appendix A.1.10 <attacca>

<attacca> An instruction to begin the next section or movement of a composition without pause.
Namespacehttp://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0
ModuleMEI.cmn
Attributesatt.common (att.basic (@xml:base) (att.id (@xml:id)) ) (att.labelled (@label)) (att.linking (@copyof, @corresp, @follows, @next, @precedes, @prev, @sameas, @synch)) (att.nNumberLike (@n)) (att.responsibility (@resp)) (att.typed (@type) (att.classed (@class)) ) att.lang (@xml:lang, @translit) att.attacca.log (@target) (att.controlEvent (att.layerIdent (@layer)) (att.partIdent (@part, @partstaff)) (att.plist (@plist)) (att.staffIdent (@staff)) (att.targetEval (@evaluate)) (att.timestamp.log (@tstamp)) (att.timestamp.ges (@tstamp.ges, @tstamp.real)) ) (att.startEndId (@endid) (att.startId (@startid)) ) (att.timestamp2.log (@tstamp2)) att.attacca.vis (att.extender (@extender) (att.lineRend (@lendsym, @lendsym.size, @lstartsym, @lstartsym.size) (att.lineRend.base (@lform, @lsegs, @lwidth)) ) ) (att.placementRelStaff (@place)) (att.verticalGroup (@vgrp)) (att.visualOffset (att.visualOffset.ho (@ho)) (att.visualOffset.to (@to)) (att.visualOffset.vo (@vo)) ) (att.visualOffset2.ho (@startho, @endho)) (att.visualOffset2.to (@startto, @endto)) (att.xy (@x, @y)) att.attacca.ges (att.timestamp2.ges (@tstamp2.ges, @tstamp2.real)) att.attacca.anl
Member of
model.controlEventLike.cmn
Contained by
MEI.cmn: measure
MEI.critapp: lem rdg
MEI.edittrans: abbr add corr damage del expan orig reg sic supplied unclear
May contain
MEI.edittrans: abbr add choice corr damage del expan gap handShift orig reg sic subst supplied unclear
MEI.ptrref: ptr ref
MEI.shared: lb name num rend
MEI.text: q seg
MEI.usersymbols: anchoredText
character data
Note

As a specialized directive, <attacca> is a control element. That is, it can be linked via its attributes to other events. The starting point of the attacca directive may be indicated by either a startid, tstamp, tstamp.ges, or tstamp.real attribute, while the ending point may be recorded by either a dur, dur.ges, endid, or tstamp2 attribute. It is a semantic error not to specify a starting point attribute.

Schematron
<sch:rule¬†context="mei:attacca[not(ancestor::mei:syllable)]"> <sch:assert¬†test="@startid or @tstamp or @tstamp.ges or @tstamp.real">Must have one of the attributes: startid, tstamp, tstamp.ges or tstamp.real.</sch:assert> </sch:rule>
Content model
<content¬†autoPrefix="true">
</content>
    ‚öì
Schema Declaration
element attacca
{
   att.common.attributes,
   att.lang.attributes,
   att.attacca.log.attributes,
   att.attacca.vis.attributes,
   att.attacca.ges.attributes,
   att.attacca.anl.attributes,
   (
      text
    |¬†model.textPhraseLike.limited
    |¬†model.graphicPrimitiveLike
    |¬†model.editLike
    |¬†model.transcriptionLike
   )*
}‚öì

Appendix A.1.12 <barLine/>

<barLine/> Vertical line drawn through one or more staves that divides musical notation into metrical units.
Namespacehttp://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0
ModuleMEI.shared
Attributesatt.common (att.basic (@xml:base) (att.id (@xml:id)) ) (att.labelled (@label)) (att.linking (@copyof, @corresp, @follows, @next, @precedes, @prev, @sameas, @synch)) (att.nNumberLike (@n)) (att.responsibility (@resp)) (att.typed (@type) (att.classed (@class)) ) att.pointing (@xlink:actuate, @xlink:role, @xlink:show, @target, @targettype) att.targetEval (@evaluate) att.barLine.log (@form) (att.meterConformance.bar (@metcon, @control)) att.barLine.vis (@len, @method, @place) (att.altSym (@altsym)) (att.color (@color)) (att.visibility (@visible)) (att.width (@width)) att.barLine.gesatt.barLine.anl
Member of
macro.annot.content model.eventLike
Contained by
MEI.cmn: beam graceGrp oLayer tuplet
MEI.critapp: lem rdg
MEI.edittrans: abbr add corr damage del expan orig reg sic supplied unclear
MEI.shared: layer
remark: annot
May containEmpty element
Note

This element is provided for repertoires, such as mensural notation, that lack measures. Because the <barLine> element‚Äôs attributes, from which the logical and visual characteristics of the bar line can be discerned, largely duplicate those of measure, the use of <barLine> is not necessary within <measure> elements in CMN.

Content model
<content¬†autoPrefix="true">
</content>
    ‚öì

{
   att.common.attributes,
   att.pointing.attributes,
   att.targetEval.attributes,
   att.barLine.log.attributes,
   att.barLine.vis.attributes,
   att.barLine.ges.attributes,
   att.barLine.anl.attributes,
   empty
}‚öì

Appendix A.1.13 <beam>

<beam> A container for a series of explicitly beamed events that begins and ends entirely within a measure.
Namespacehttp://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0
ModuleMEI.cmn
Attributesatt.common (att.basic (@xml:base) (att.id (@xml:id)) ) (att.labelled (@label)) (att.linking (@copyof, @corresp, @follows, @next, @precedes, @prev, @sameas, @synch)) (att.nNumberLike (@n)) (att.responsibility (@resp)) (att.typed (@type) (att.classed (@class)) ) att.beam.log (att.event (att.layerIdent (@layer)) (att.staffIdent (@staff)) (att.timestamp.ges (@tstamp.ges, @tstamp.real)) (att.timestamp.log (@tstamp)) ) (att.beamedWith (@beam.with)) att.beam.vis (att.color (@color)) (att.cue (@cue)) (att.beamRend (@form, @place, @slash, @slope)) (att.visibility (@visible)) att.beam.gesatt.beam.anl
Member of
macro.annot.content model.eventLike.cmn
Contained by
MEI.cmn: beam graceGrp oLayer tuplet
MEI.critapp: lem rdg
MEI.edittrans: abbr add corr damage del expan orig reg sic supplied unclear
MEI.shared: layer
remark: annot
May contain
MEI.cmn: bTrem beam beatRpt fTrem graceGrp halfmRpt meterSig meterSigGrp tuplet
MEI.critapp: app
MEI.edittrans: add choice corr damage del gap handShift orig reg sic subst supplied unclear
MEI.shared: barLine chord clef keySig note pad rest space
Note

For beams that cross the bar line, use the <beamSpan> element. Secondary beams may be broken explicitly using the breaksec attribute on the notes or chords under the beam. Automated beaming, as opposed to explicitly marked beams, may be indicated for an entire score, part or section by using the beam.group and beam.rests attributes on these elements.

Schematron
<sch:rule¬†context="mei:beam[not(@copyof or @sameas)]"> <sch:assert¬†test="count(descendant::*[local-name()='note' or local-name()='rest' or local-name()='chord' or local-name()='space']) > 1">A beam that contains neither a copyof nor sameas attribute must have at least 2 note, rest, chord, or space descendants.</sch:assert> </sch:rule>
Content model
<content¬†autoPrefix="true">
</content>
    ‚öì
Schema Declaration

{
   att.common.attributes,
   att.beam.log.attributes,
   att.beam.vis.attributes,
   att.beam.ges.attributes,
   att.beam.anl.attributes,

      model.eventLike
    |¬†model.eventLike.cmn
    |¬†model.appLike
    |¬†model.editLike
    |¬†model.transcriptionLike
   )*
}‚öì

Note

<beatRpt> may also be used in guitar or rhythm parts to indicate where chord changes occur. When these parts require durations longer or shorter than a beat; however, <note> elements with appropriately-shaped note heads should be employed.

Appendix A.1.17 <bracketSpan>

<bracketSpan> Marks a sequence of notational events grouped by a bracket.
Namespacehttp://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0
ModuleMEI.cmn
Attributesatt.common (att.basic (@xml:base) (att.id (@xml:id)) ) (att.labelled (@label)) (att.linking (@copyof, @corresp, @follows, @next, @precedes, @prev, @sameas, @synch)) (att.nNumberLike (@n)) (att.responsibility (@resp)) (att.typed (@type) (att.classed (@class)) ) att.bracketSpan.log (@func) (att.controlEvent (att.layerIdent (@layer)) (att.partIdent (@part, @partstaff)) (att.plist (@plist)) (att.staffIdent (@staff)) (att.targetEval (@evaluate)) (att.timestamp.log (@tstamp)) (att.timestamp.ges (@tstamp.ges, @tstamp.real)) ) (att.duration.additive (@dur)) (att.startEndId (@endid) (att.startId (@startid)) ) (att.timestamp2.log (@tstamp2)) att.bracketSpan.vis (att.altSym (@altsym)) (att.color (@color)) (att.lineRend (@lendsym, @lendsym.size, @lstartsym, @lstartsym.size) (att.lineRend.base (@lform, @lsegs, @lwidth)) ) (att.typography (@fontfam, @fontname, @fontsize, @fontstyle, @fontweight, @letterspacing, @lineheight)) (att.visualOffset (att.visualOffset.ho (@ho)) (att.visualOffset.to (@to)) (att.visualOffset.vo (@vo)) ) (att.visualOffset2 (att.visualOffset2.ho (@startho, @endho)) (att.visualOffset2.to (@startto, @endto)) (att.visualOffset2.vo (@startvo, @endvo)) ) (att.xy (@x, @y)) (att.xy2 (@x2, @y2)) att.bracketSpan.ges (att.duration.ges (@dur.ges, @dots.ges, @dur.metrical, @dur.ppq, @dur.real, @dur.recip)) (att.timestamp2.ges (@tstamp2.ges, @tstamp2.real)) att.bracketSpan.anl
Member of
model.controlEventLike.cmn
Contained by
MEI.cmn: measure
MEI.critapp: lem rdg
MEI.edittrans: abbr add corr damage del expan orig reg sic supplied unclear
May contain
MEI.edittrans: abbr expan
MEI.ptrref: ptr ref
MEI.shared: lb name num rend
MEI.text: q seg
character data
Note

Text that interrupts the bracket used to mark the event group may be captured as the content of <bracketSpan>. The starting point of the group/bracket may be indicated by either a startid, tstamp, tstamp.ges, or tstamp.real attribute, while the ending point may be recorded by either a dur, dur.ges, endid, or tstamp2 attribute. It is a semantic error not to specify one starting and one ending type of attribute.

Schematron
<sch:rule¬†context="mei:bracketSpan"> <sch:assert¬†test="@startid or @tstamp or @tstamp.ges or @tstamp.real">Must have one of the attributes: startid, tstamp, tstamp.ges or tstamp.real.</sch:assert> <sch:assert¬†test="@dur or @dur.ges or @endid or @tstamp2">Must have one of the attributes: dur, dur.ges, endid, or tstamp2.</sch:assert> </sch:rule>
Content model
<content¬†autoPrefix="true">
</content>
    ‚öì

element bracketSpan
{
   att.common.attributes,
   att.bracketSpan.log.attributes,
   att.bracketSpan.vis.attributes,
   att.bracketSpan.ges.attributes,
   att.bracketSpan.anl.attributes,
   ( text | model.textPhraseLike.limited )*
}‚öì

Appendix A.1.18 <breath/>

<breath/> (breath mark) An indication of a point at which the performer on an instrument requiring breath (including the voice) may breathe.
Namespacehttp://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0
ModuleMEI.cmn
Attributesatt.common (att.basic (@xml:base) (att.id (@xml:id)) ) (att.labelled (@label)) (att.linking (@copyof, @corresp, @follows, @next, @precedes, @prev, @sameas, @synch)) (att.nNumberLike (@n)) (att.responsibility (@resp)) (att.typed (@type) (att.classed (@class)) ) att.breath.log (att.layerIdent (@layer)) (att.partIdent (@part, @partstaff)) (att.staffIdent (@staff)) (att.startId (@startid)) (att.timestamp.log (@tstamp)) att.breath.vis (att.altSym (@altsym)) (att.color (@color)) (att.placementRelStaff (@place)) (att.staffLoc (@loc)) (att.staffLoc.pitched (@ploc, @oloc)) (att.typography (@fontfam, @fontname, @fontsize, @fontstyle, @fontweight, @letterspacing, @lineheight)) (att.visualOffset (att.visualOffset.ho (@ho)) (att.visualOffset.to (@to)) (att.visualOffset.vo (@vo)) ) (att.xy (@x, @y)) att.breath.ges (att.timestamp.ges (@tstamp.ges, @tstamp.real)) att.breath.anl
Member of
model.controlEventLike.cmn
Contained by
MEI.cmn: measure
MEI.critapp: lem rdg
MEI.edittrans: abbr add corr damage del expan orig reg sic supplied unclear
May containEmpty element
Note

This element may also indicate a short pause or break for instruments *not* requiring breath. In such cases, it functions as a guide to phrasing. The starting point of the breath mark may be indicated by either a startid, tstamp, tstamp.ges, or tstamp.real attribute. It is a semantic error not to specify a starting point attribute.

Since the breath mark does not disrupt the normal tempo of a performance, it has no directly encode-able duration.

The default value for place for a breath mark is "above". Unless indicated by other attributes, a breath mark will be rendered as a comma-like symbol above the top line of the staff.

Schematron
<sch:rule¬†context="mei:breath"> <sch:assert¬†test="@startid or @tstamp or @tstamp.ges or @tstamp.real">Must have one of the attributes: startid, tstamp, tstamp.ges or tstamp.real.</sch:assert> </sch:rule>
Content model
<content¬†autoPrefix="true">
</content>
    ‚öì
Schema Declaration
element breath
{
   att.common.attributes,
   att.breath.log.attributes,
   att.breath.vis.attributes,
   att.breath.ges.attributes,
   att.breath.anl.attributes,
   empty
}‚öì

Appendix A.1.19 <caesura/>

<caesura/> Break, pause, or interruption in the normal tempo of a composition. Typically indicated by "railroad tracks", i.e., two diagonal slashes.
Namespacehttp://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0
ModuleMEI.shared
Attributesatt.common (att.basic (@xml:base) (att.id (@xml:id)) ) (att.labelled (@label)) (att.linking (@copyof, @corresp, @follows, @next, @precedes, @prev, @sameas, @synch)) (att.nNumberLike (@n)) (att.responsibility (@resp)) (att.typed (@type) (att.classed (@class)) ) att.caesura.anlatt.caesura.ges (att.duration.ges (@dur.ges, @dots.ges, @dur.metrical, @dur.ppq, @dur.real, @dur.recip)) (att.timestamp.ges (@tstamp.ges, @tstamp.real)) att.caesura.log (att.layerIdent (@layer)) (att.partIdent (@part, @partstaff)) (att.staffIdent (@staff)) (att.startId (@startid)) (att.timestamp.log (@tstamp)) att.caesura.vis (att.altSym (@altsym)) (att.color (@color)) (att.placementRelStaff (@place)) (att.staffLoc (@loc)) (att.staffLoc.pitched (@ploc, @oloc)) (att.typography (@fontfam, @fontname, @fontsize, @fontstyle, @fontweight, @letterspacing, @lineheight)) (att.visualOffset (att.visualOffset.ho (@ho)) (att.visualOffset.to (@to)) (att.visualOffset.vo (@vo)) ) (att.xy (@x, @y))
Member of
macro.annot.content model.controlEventLike
Contained by
MEI.cmn: measure
MEI.critapp: lem rdg
MEI.edittrans: abbr add corr damage del expan orig reg sic supplied unclear
remark: annot
May containEmpty element
Note

The caesura often indicates an abrupt interruption in the performance followed by an equally sudden resumption. Its duration is typically shorter than a grand pause (G.P.) or long pause (L.P.), but longer than that indicated by a <breath> mark. When combined with a <fermata> a longer silence is usually implied. The starting point of the caesura may be indicated by either a startid, tstamp, tstamp.ges, or tstamp.real attribute. It is a semantic error not to specify a starting point attribute.

Unlike the <breath> mark, a caesura may have a performed duration. Also, while the default value for place on the breath mark is above, the default value for place for a caesura is within. Unless indicated by other attributes, a caesura will be rendered as a pair of slanted lines through the top line of the staff.

Schematron
<sch:rule¬†context="mei:caesura"> <sch:assert¬†test="@startid or @tstamp or @tstamp.ges or @tstamp.real">Must have one of the attributes: startid, tstamp, tstamp.ges or tstamp.real.</sch:assert> </sch:rule>
Content model
<content¬†autoPrefix="true">
</content>
    ‚öì
Schema Declaration
element caesura
{
   att.common.attributes,
   att.caesura.anl.attributes,
   att.caesura.ges.attributes,
   att.caesura.log.attributes,
   att.caesura.vis.attributes,
   empty
}‚öì

Appendix A.1.20 <choice>

<choice> Groups a number of alternative encodings for the same point in a text.
Namespacehttp://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0
ModuleMEI.edittrans
Attributesatt.common (att.basic (@xml:base) (att.id (@xml:id)) ) (att.labelled (@label)) (att.linking (@copyof, @corresp, @follows, @next, @precedes, @prev, @sameas, @synch)) (att.nNumberLike (@n)) (att.responsibility (@resp)) (att.typed (@type) (att.classed (@class)) )
Member of
model.editLike
Contained by
MEI.cmn: attacca beam graceGrp measure oLayer oStaff tuplet
MEI.critapp: lem rdg
MEI.edittrans: abbr add choice corr damage del expan orig reg sic supplied unclear
MEI.shared: chord dir dynam ending label labelAbbr layer name note num ornam rend rest section staff syl tempo
MEI.text: quote seg
MEI.usersymbols: anchoredText
May contain
MEI.edittrans: abbr choice corr expan orig reg sic subst unclear
Note

Because the children of a <choice> element all represent alternative ways of encoding the same sequence, it is natural to think of them as mutually exclusive. However, there may be cases where a full representation of a text requires the alternative encodings to be considered as parallel. Note also that <choice> elements may be recursively nested.

Note

The model of this element is based on the choice element of the Text Encoding Initiative (TEI).

Content model
<content¬†autoPrefix="true">
</content>
    ‚öì
Schema Declaration
element choice { att.common.attributes, model.choicePart* }‚öì

Appendix A.1.25 <clef/>

<clef/> Indication of the exact location of a particular note on the staff and, therefore, the other notes as well.
Namespacehttp://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0
ModuleMEI.shared
Attributesatt.common (att.basic (@xml:base) (att.id (@xml:id)) ) (att.labelled (@label)) (att.linking (@copyof, @corresp, @follows, @next, @precedes, @prev, @sameas, @synch)) (att.nNumberLike (@n)) (att.responsibility (@resp)) (att.typed (@type) (att.classed (@class)) ) att.event (att.layerIdent (@layer)) (att.staffIdent (@staff)) (att.timestamp.ges (@tstamp.ges, @tstamp.real)) (att.timestamp.log (@tstamp)) att.clef.anlatt.clef.gesatt.clef.log (@cautionary) (att.clefShape (@shape)) (att.lineLoc (@line)) (att.octave (@oct)) (att.octaveDisplacement (@dis, @dis.place)) att.clef.vis (att.altSym (@altsym)) (att.color (@color)) (att.enclosingChars (@enclose)) (att.typography (@fontfam, @fontname, @fontsize, @fontstyle, @fontweight, @letterspacing, @lineheight)) (att.visibility (@visible)) (att.visualOffset (att.visualOffset.ho (@ho)) (att.visualOffset.to (@to)) (att.visualOffset.vo (@vo)) )
Member of
macro.annot.content model.eventLike model.staffDefPart
Contained by
MEI.cmn: beam fTrem graceGrp oLayer tuplet
MEI.critapp: lem rdg
MEI.edittrans: abbr add corr damage del expan orig reg sic supplied unclear
MEI.shared: layer staffDef
remark: annot
May containEmpty element
Note

This element can be used as an alternative to the <staff> element's clef.* attributes. It should be used when specific display info, such as size or color, needs to be recorded for the clef or when multiple, simultaneous clefs occur on a single staff. This element may also be used within the staff context to indicate changes of clef.

Schematron
<sch:rule¬†context="mei:clef[matches(@shape, '[FCG]')][ancestor::mei:staffDef[@lines]]"> <sch:let¬†name="thisstaff" ¬†value="ancestor::mei:staffDef/@n"/> <sch:assert¬†test="number(@line) <= number(ancestor::mei:staffDef[@n=$thisstaff and @lines][1]/@lines)">The clef position must be less than or equal to the number of lines of an ancestor staff.</sch:assert> </sch:rule>
Schematron
<sch:rule¬†context="mei:clef[ancestor::mei:staffDef[not(@lines)]]"> <sch:let¬†name="thisstaff" ¬†value="ancestor::mei:staffDef/@n"/> <sch:assert¬†test="number(@line) <= number(preceding::mei:staffDef[@n=$thisstaff and @lines][1]/@lines)">The clef position must be less than or equal to the number of lines of a preceding staff.</sch:assert> </sch:rule>
Content model
<content¬†autoPrefix="true">
</content>
    ‚öì

Appendix A.1.26 <corr>

<corr> (correction) Contains the correct form of an apparent erroneous passage.
Namespacehttp://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0
ModuleMEI.edittrans
Attributesatt.common (att.basic (@xml:base) (att.id (@xml:id)) ) (att.labelled (@label)) (att.linking (@copyof, @corresp, @follows, @next, @precedes, @prev, @sameas, @synch)) (att.nNumberLike (@n)) (att.responsibility (@resp)) (att.typed (@type) (att.classed (@class)) ) att.edit (att.source (@source)) (att.evidence (@cert, @evidence)) att.extent (@extent) (att.measurement (@unit)) (att.ranging (@atleast, @atmost, @min, @max, @confidence)) att.lang (@xml:lang, @translit) att.trans (att.handIdent (@hand)) (att.metadataPointing (@decls)) (att.sequence (@seq))
Member of
macro.annot.content model.choicePart model.transcriptionLike
Contained by
MEI.cmn: attacca beam graceGrp measure oLayer oStaff tuplet
MEI.critapp: lem rdg
MEI.edittrans: abbr add choice corr damage del expan orig reg sic subst supplied unclear
MEI.shared: chord dir dynam ending keySig label labelAbbr layer name note num ornam rend rest section staff syl tempo
MEI.text: quote seg
MEI.usersymbols: anchoredText
remark: annot
May contain
MEI.cmn: arpeg attacca bTrem beam beamSpan beatRpt bend bracketSpan breath fTrem fermata gliss graceGrp hairpin halfmRpt harpPedal lv mRest mRpt mRpt2 mSpace measure meterSig meterSigGrp multiRest multiRpt octave pedal reh slur tie tuplet tupletSpan
MEI.cmnOrnaments: trill
MEI.edittrans: abbr add choice corr damage del expan gap handShift orig reg sic subst supplied unclear
MEI.ptrref: ptr ref
MEI.shared: accid artic barLine caesura chord clef dir dot dynam ending keyAccid keySig layer lb lg name note num ornam pad pb rend rest sb scoreDef section space staff staffDef staffGrp syl tempo
MEI.text: q quote seg
MEI.usersymbols: anchoredText
character data
Note

The cert attribute signifies the degree of certainty ascribed to correction. The resp attribute contains an ID reference to an element containing the name of the editor or transcriber responsible for suggesting the correction held as the content of the <corr> element. If the correction was made in the source, resp should be used to identify the hand of the corrector. The value of resp must point to one or more identifiers declared in the document header.

In no case should <corr> contain elements that would not otherwise be permitted to occur within the parent of its own <app> ancestor. For example, when used as a descendent of <verse>, <corr> should only contain those elements allowed within <verse>.

Note

The model of this element is based on the corr element of the Text Encoding Initiative (TEI).

Content model
<content¬†autoPrefix="true">
</content>
    ‚öì
Schema Declaration
element corr
{
   att.common.attributes,
   att.edit.attributes,
   att.extent.attributes,
   att.lang.attributes,
   att.trans.attributes,
   (
      text
    |¬†model.divLike
    |¬†model.editLike
    |¬†model.editTransPart
    |¬†model.fLike
    |¬†model.graphicPrimitiveLike
    |¬†model.keyAccidLike
    |¬†model.layerPart
    |¬†model.milestoneLike.music
    |¬†model.neumeComponentModifierLike
    |¬†model.neumeModifierLike
    |¬†model.neumePart
    |¬†model.sectionPart
    |¬†model.staffGrpLike
    |¬†model.transcriptionLike
   )*
}‚öì

Appendix A.1.29 <del>

<del> (deletion) Contains information deleted, marked as deleted, or otherwise indicated as superfluous or spurious in the copy text by an author, scribe, annotator, or corrector.
Namespacehttp://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0
ModuleMEI.edittrans
Attributesatt.common (att.basic (@xml:base) (att.id (@xml:id)) ) (att.labelled (@label)) (att.linking (@copyof, @corresp, @follows, @next, @precedes, @prev, @sameas, @synch)) (att.nNumberLike (@n)) (att.responsibility (@resp)) (att.typed (@type) (att.classed (@class)) ) att.edit (att.source (@source)) (att.evidence (@cert, @evidence)) att.extent (@extent) (att.measurement (@unit)) (att.ranging (@atleast, @atmost, @min, @max, @confidence)) att.lang (@xml:lang, @translit) att.textRendition (@altrend, @rend) att.trans (att.handIdent (@hand)) (att.metadataPointing (@decls)) (att.sequence (@seq))
Member of
macro.annot.content model.transcriptionLike
Contained by
MEI.cmn: attacca beam graceGrp measure oLayer oStaff tuplet
MEI.critapp: lem rdg
MEI.edittrans: abbr add corr damage del expan orig reg sic subst supplied unclear
MEI.shared: chord dir dynam ending keySig label labelAbbr layer name note num ornam rend rest section staff syl tempo
MEI.text: quote seg
MEI.usersymbols: anchoredText
remark: annot
May contain
MEI.cmn: arpeg attacca bTrem beam beamSpan beatRpt bend bracketSpan breath fTrem fermata gliss graceGrp hairpin halfmRpt harpPedal lv mRest mRpt mRpt2 mSpace measure meterSig meterSigGrp multiRest multiRpt octave pedal reh slur tie tuplet tupletSpan
MEI.cmnOrnaments: trill
MEI.edittrans: abbr add choice corr damage del expan gap handShift orig reg sic subst supplied unclear
MEI.ptrref: ptr ref
MEI.shared: accid artic barLine caesura chord clef dir dot dynam ending keyAccid keySig layer lb lg name note num ornam pad pb rend rest sb scoreDef section space staff staffDef staffGrp syl tempo
MEI.text: q quote seg
MEI.usersymbols: anchoredText
character data
Note

The resp attribute contains an ID reference to an element containing the name of the editor or transcriber responsible for identifying the hand of the deletion. The cert attribute signifies the degree of certainty ascribed to the identification of the hand of the deletion. The hand of the agent which made the deletion should be pointed to using the hand attribute. The rend attribute may be used to record the method used to make the deletion (overstrike, strike[through], etc.).

In no case should <del> contain elements that would not otherwise be permitted to occur within the parent of its own <app> ancestor. For example, when used as a descendent of <verse>, <del> should only contain those elements allowed within <verse>.

Note

The model of this element is based on the del element of the Text Encoding Initiative (TEI).

Content model
<content¬†autoPrefix="true">
</content>
    ‚öì
Schema Declaration
element del
{
   att.common.attributes,
   att.edit.attributes,
   att.extent.attributes,
   att.lang.attributes,
   att.textRendition.attributes,
   att.trans.attributes,
   (
      text
    |¬†model.divLike
    |¬†model.editLike
    |¬†model.editTransPart
    |¬†model.fLike
    |¬†model.graphicPrimitiveLike
    |¬†model.keyAccidLike
    |¬†model.layerPart
    |¬†model.milestoneLike.music
    |¬†model.neumeComponentModifierLike
    |¬†model.neumeModifierLike
    |¬†model.neumePart
    |¬†model.sectionPart
    |¬†model.staffGrpLike
    |¬†model.transcriptionLike
   )*
}‚öì

Appendix A.1.30 <dir>

<dir> (directive) An instruction expressed as a combination of text and symbols ‚Äî such as segno and coda symbols, fermatas over a bar line, etc., typically above, below, or between staves, but not on the staff ‚Äî that is not encoded elsewhere in more specific elements, like <tempo> or <dynam>.
Namespacehttp://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0
ModuleMEI.shared
Attributesatt.common (att.basic (@xml:base) (att.id (@xml:id)) ) (att.labelled (@label)) (att.linking (@copyof, @corresp, @follows, @next, @precedes, @prev, @sameas, @synch)) (att.nNumberLike (@n)) (att.responsibility (@resp)) (att.typed (@type) (att.classed (@class)) ) att.lang (@xml:lang, @translit) att.dir.log (att.controlEvent (att.layerIdent (@layer)) (att.partIdent (@part, @partstaff)) (att.plist (@plist)) (att.staffIdent (@staff)) (att.targetEval (@evaluate)) (att.timestamp.log (@tstamp)) (att.timestamp.ges (@tstamp.ges, @tstamp.real)) ) (att.duration.additive (@dur)) (att.startEndId (@endid) (att.startId (@startid)) ) (att.timestamp2.log (@tstamp2)) att.dir.vis (att.extender (@extender) (att.lineRend (@lendsym, @lendsym.size, @lstartsym, @lstartsym.size) (att.lineRend.base (@lform, @lsegs, @lwidth)) ) ) (att.placementRelStaff (@place)) (att.verticalGroup (@vgrp)) (att.visualOffset (att.visualOffset.ho (@ho)) (att.visualOffset.to (@to)) (att.visualOffset.vo (@vo)) ) (att.visualOffset2.ho (@startho, @endho)) (att.visualOffset2.to (@startto, @endto)) (att.xy (@x, @y)) att.dir.ges (att.duration.ges (@dur.ges, @dots.ges, @dur.metrical, @dur.ppq, @dur.real, @dur.recip)) (att.timestamp2.ges (@tstamp2.ges, @tstamp2.real)) att.dir.anl
Member of
macro.annot.content model.controlEventLike
Contained by
MEI.cmn: measure
MEI.critapp: lem rdg
MEI.edittrans: abbr add corr damage del expan orig reg sic supplied unclear
remark: annot
May contain
MEI.edittrans: abbr add choice corr damage del expan gap handShift orig reg sic subst supplied unclear
MEI.ptrref: ptr ref
MEI.shared: lb name num rend
MEI.text: q seg
MEI.usersymbols: anchoredText
character data
Note

Examples include text strings, such as 'affettuoso', and music symbols, such as segno and coda symbols, fermatas over a bar line, etc. Directives can be control elements. That is, they can be linked via their attributes to other events. The starting point of the directive may be indicated by either a startid, tstamp, tstamp.ges, or tstamp.real attribute, while the ending point may be recorded by either a dur, dur.ges, endid, or tstamp2 attribute. It is a semantic error not to specify a starting point attribute.

Schematron
<sch:rule¬†context="mei:dir[not(ancestor::mei:syllable)]"> <sch:assert¬†test="@startid or @tstamp or @tstamp.ges or @tstamp.real">Must have one of the attributes: startid, tstamp, tstamp.ges or tstamp.real.</sch:assert> </sch:rule>
Content model
<content¬†autoPrefix="true">
</content>
    ‚öì

      text

    |¬†model.graphicPrimitiveLike
    |¬†model.editLike
    |¬†model.transcriptionLike
   )*
}‚öì

Appendix A.1.31 <dot/>

<dot/> Dot of augmentation or division.
Namespacehttp://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0
ModuleMEI.shared
Attributesatt.common (att.basic (@xml:base) (att.id (@xml:id)) ) (att.labelled (@label)) (att.linking (@copyof, @corresp, @follows, @next, @precedes, @prev, @sameas, @synch)) (att.nNumberLike (@n)) (att.responsibility (@resp)) (att.typed (@type) (att.classed (@class)) ) att.dot.log (@form) (att.controlEvent (att.layerIdent (@layer)) (att.partIdent (@part, @partstaff)) (att.plist (@plist)) (att.staffIdent (@staff)) (att.targetEval (@evaluate)) (att.timestamp.log (@tstamp)) (att.timestamp.ges (@tstamp.ges, @tstamp.real)) ) att.dot.vis (att.altSym (@altsym)) (att.color (@color)) (att.staffLoc (@loc)) (att.staffLoc.pitched (@ploc, @oloc)) (att.typography (@fontfam, @fontname, @fontsize, @fontstyle, @fontweight, @letterspacing, @lineheight)) (att.visualOffset.ho (@ho)) (att.visualOffset.vo (@vo)) (att.xy (@x, @y)) att.dot.gesatt.dot.anl

macro.annot.content model.noteModifierLike
Contained by
MEI.cmn: oLayer
MEI.critapp: lem rdg
MEI.edittrans: abbr add corr damage del expan orig reg sic supplied unclear
MEI.shared: layer note rest
remark: annot
May containEmpty element
Note

This element provides an alternative to the dots attribute on <note> and <rest> elements. It should be used when specific display info, such as size or color, needs to be recorded for the dot. This element may also be used for dots of division in the mensural repertoire.

Appendix A.1.32 <dynam>

<dynam> (dynamic) Indication of the volume of a note, phrase, or section of music.
Namespacehttp://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0
ModuleMEI.shared
Attributesatt.common (att.basic (@xml:base) (att.id (@xml:id)) ) (att.labelled (@label)) (att.linking (@copyof, @corresp, @follows, @next, @precedes, @prev, @sameas, @synch)) (att.nNumberLike (@n)) (att.responsibility (@resp)) (att.typed (@type) (att.classed (@class)) ) att.dynam.log (att.controlEvent (att.layerIdent (@layer)) (att.partIdent (@part, @partstaff)) (att.plist (@plist)) (att.staffIdent (@staff)) (att.targetEval (@evaluate)) (att.timestamp.log (@tstamp)) (att.timestamp.ges (@tstamp.ges, @tstamp.real)) ) (att.duration.additive (@dur)) (att.startEndId (@endid) (att.startId (@startid)) ) (att.timestamp2.log (@tstamp2)) att.dynam.vis (att.extender (@extender) (att.lineRend (@lendsym, @lendsym.size, @lstartsym, @lstartsym.size) (att.lineRend.base (@lform, @lsegs, @lwidth)) ) ) (att.placementRelStaff (@place)) (att.verticalGroup (@vgrp)) (att.visualOffset (att.visualOffset.ho (@ho)) (att.visualOffset.to (@to)) (att.visualOffset.vo (@vo)) ) (att.visualOffset2.ho (@startho, @endho)) (att.visualOffset2.to (@startto, @endto)) (att.xy (@x, @y)) att.dynam.ges (att.duration.ges (@dur.ges, @dots.ges, @dur.metrical, @dur.ppq, @dur.real, @dur.recip)) (att.timestamp2.ges (@tstamp2.ges, @tstamp2.real)) att.dynam.anlatt.lang (@xml:lang, @translit)
Member of
macro.annot.content model.controlEventLike
Contained by
MEI.cmn: measure
MEI.critapp: lem rdg
MEI.edittrans: abbr add corr damage del expan orig reg sic supplied unclear
remark: annot
May contain
MEI.edittrans: abbr add choice corr damage del expan gap handShift orig reg sic subst supplied unclear
MEI.ptrref: ptr ref
MEI.shared: lb name num rend
MEI.text: q seg
character data
Note

This element may be used for instantaneous or continuous textual dynamics, e.g., 'p', 'mf', or 'cresc. poco a poco'. The <hairpin> element should be used for graphical, i.e., crescendo and diminuendo, dynamic markings. The starting point of the dynamic marking may be indicated by either a startid, tstamp, tstamp.ges, or tstamp.real attribute, while the ending point may be recorded by either a dur, dur.ges, endid, or tstamp2 attribute. It is a semantic error not to specify a starting point attribute. MIDI values associated with the graphical dynamic sign may be recorded in the val and val2 attributes.

Schematron
<sch:rule¬†context="mei:dynam"> <sch:assert¬†test="@startid or @tstamp or @tstamp.ges or @tstamp.real"> Must have one of the attributes: startid, tstamp, tstamp.ges or tstamp.real.</sch:assert> </sch:rule>
Schematron
<sch:rule¬†context="mei:dynam[@val2]"> <sch:assert¬†test="@dur or @dur.ges or @endid or @tstamp2">When @val2 is present, either @dur, @dur.ges, @endid, or @tstamp2 must also be present.</sch:assert> </sch:rule>
Content model
<content¬†autoPrefix="true">
</content>
    ‚öì
Schema Declaration
element dynam
{
   att.common.attributes,
   att.dynam.log.attributes,
   att.dynam.vis.attributes,
   att.dynam.ges.attributes,
   att.dynam.anl.attributes,
   att.lang.attributes,
   (
      text
    |¬†model.textPhraseLike.limited
    |¬†model.editLike
    |¬†model.transcriptionLike
   )*
}‚öì

Appendix A.1.35 <ending>

<ending> Alternative ending for a repeated passage of music; i.e., prima volta, seconda volta, etc.
Namespacehttp://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0
ModuleMEI.shared
Attributesatt.common (att.basic (@xml:base) (att.id (@xml:id)) ) (att.labelled (@label)) (att.linking (@copyof, @corresp, @follows, @next, @precedes, @prev, @sameas, @synch)) (att.nNumberLike (@n)) (att.responsibility (@resp)) (att.typed (@type) (att.classed (@class)) ) att.ending.anlatt.ending.gesatt.ending.logatt.ending.vis (att.lineRend (@lendsym, @lendsym.size, @lstartsym, @lstartsym.size) (att.lineRend.base (@lform, @lsegs, @lwidth)) ) att.pointing (@xlink:actuate, @xlink:role, @xlink:show, @target, @targettype) att.targetEval (@evaluate)

MEI.edittrans: add choice corr damage del gap handShift orig reg sic subst supplied unclear
MEI.shared: expansion pb sb scoreDef section staff staffDef
MEI.usersymbols: anchoredText
Note

The <scoreDef> element is allowed as a sub-element so that an ending may have its own meta-data without the overhead of child <section> elements. <div> sub-elements are not allowed within ending. They may, however, be contained by the children of ending, e.g., measures. Endings may not contain other ending elements.

abbrCaptures the abbreviated form of the text.

model.editorialLike

MEI.text: q quote seg
MEI.usersymbols: anchoredText
character data
Note

In no case should <expan> contain elements that would not otherwise be permitted to occur within the parent of its own <app> ancestor. For example, when used as a descendent of <verse>, <expan> should only contain those elements allowed within <verse>.

Note

The model of this element is based on the expan element of the Text Encoding Initiative (TEI) and the expan element of the Encoded Archival Description (EAD).

Appendix A.1.37 <expansion/>

<expansion/> Indicates how a section may be programmatically expanded into its 'through-composed' form.
Namespacehttp://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0
ModuleMEI.shared
Attributesatt.common (att.basic (@xml:base) (att.id (@xml:id)) ) (att.labelled (@label)) (att.linking (@copyof, @corresp, @follows, @next, @precedes, @prev, @sameas, @synch)) (att.nNumberLike (@n)) (att.responsibility (@resp)) (att.typed (@type) (att.classed (@class)) ) att.plist (@plist) att.source (@source) att.targetEval (@evaluate)
Contained by
MEI.critapp: lem rdg
MEI.shared: ending section
May containEmpty element
Note

The plist attribute contains an ordered list of identifiers of descendant <section>, <ending>, <lem>, or <rdg> elements. For example, the sequence "#A #End1 #A #End2" indicates that the section labelled 'A' comes first, then the ending labelled 'End1', followed by the 'A' section again, and finally the ending labelled 'End2'.

Content model
<content¬†autoPrefix="true">
</content>
    ‚öì
Schema Declaration
element expansion
{
   att.common.attributes,
   att.plist.attributes,
   att.source.attributes,
   att.targetEval.attributes,
   empty
}‚öì

Appendix A.1.38 <fTrem>

<fTrem> (fingered tremolo) A rapid alternation between a pair of notes (or chords or perhaps between a note and a chord) that are (usually) farther apart than a major second.

Appendix A.1.39 <fermata/>

<fermata/> An indication placed over a note or rest to indicate that it should be held longer than its written value. May also occur over a bar line to indicate the end of a phrase or section. Sometimes called a 'hold' or 'pause'.
Namespacehttp://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0
ModuleMEI.cmn
Attributesatt.common (att.basic (@xml:base) (att.id (@xml:id)) ) (att.labelled (@label)) (att.linking (@copyof, @corresp, @follows, @next, @precedes, @prev, @sameas, @synch)) (att.nNumberLike (@n)) (att.responsibility (@resp)) (att.typed (@type) (att.classed (@class)) ) att.fermata.log (att.controlEvent (att.layerIdent (@layer)) (att.partIdent (@part, @partstaff)) (att.plist (@plist)) (att.staffIdent (@staff)) (att.targetEval (@evaluate)) (att.timestamp.log (@tstamp)) (att.timestamp.ges (@tstamp.ges, @tstamp.real)) ) (att.startEndId (@endid) (att.startId (@startid)) ) att.fermata.vis (@form, @shape) (att.altSym (@altsym)) (att.color (@color)) (att.enclosingChars (@enclose)) (att.placementRelStaff (@place)) (att.typography (@fontfam, @fontname, @fontsize, @fontstyle, @fontweight, @letterspacing, @lineheight)) (att.visualOffset (att.visualOffset.ho (@ho)) (att.visualOffset.to (@to)) (att.visualOffset.vo (@vo)) ) (att.xy (@x, @y)) att.fermata.ges (att.duration.ges (@dur.ges, @dots.ges, @dur.metrical, @dur.ppq, @dur.real, @dur.recip)) att.fermata.anl
Member of
macro.annot.content model.controlEventLike.cmn
Contained by
MEI.cmn: measure
MEI.critapp: lem rdg
MEI.edittrans: abbr add corr damage del expan orig reg sic supplied unclear
remark: annot
May containEmpty element
Note

The shape attribute may be used to record whether the fermata is curved, square, or triangular, while form may be used to capture whether the fermata is "upright", i.e., has the curve or bracket above the dot, or inverted, i.e., has the curve or bracket below the dot. Other visual forms of a fermata may be indicated via the altsym attribute. The starting point of the fermata may be indicated by either a startid, tstamp, tstamp.ges, or tstamp.real attribute. It is a semantic error not to specify a starting point attribute.

Schematron
<sch:rule¬†context="mei:fermata"> <sch:assert¬†test="@startid or @tstamp or @tstamp.ges or @tstamp.real">Must have one of the attributes: startid, tstamp, tstamp.ges or tstamp.real.</sch:assert> </sch:rule>
Content model
<content¬†autoPrefix="true">
</content>
    ‚öì
Schema Declaration
element fermata
{
   att.common.attributes,
   att.fermata.log.attributes,
   att.fermata.vis.attributes,
   att.fermata.ges.attributes,
   att.fermata.anl.attributes,
   empty
}‚öì

Appendix A.1.40 <gap/>

<gap/> Indicates a point where material has been omitted in a transcription, whether as part of sampling practice or for editorial reasons described in the MEI header.
Namespacehttp://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0
ModuleMEI.edittrans
Attributesatt.common (att.basic (@xml:base) (att.id (@xml:id)) ) (att.labelled (@label)) (att.linking (@copyof, @corresp, @follows, @next, @precedes, @prev, @sameas, @synch)) (att.nNumberLike (@n)) (att.responsibility (@resp)) (att.typed (@type) (att.classed (@class)) ) att.edit (att.source (@source)) (att.evidence (@cert, @evidence)) att.extent (@extent) (att.measurement (@unit)) (att.ranging (@atleast, @atmost, @min, @max, @confidence)) att.handIdent (@hand) att.reasonIdent (@reason)
Member of
model.transcriptionLike
Contained by
MEI.cmn: attacca beam graceGrp measure oLayer oStaff tuplet
MEI.critapp: lem rdg
MEI.edittrans: abbr add corr damage del expan orig reg sic subst supplied unclear
MEI.shared: chord dir dynam ending keySig label labelAbbr layer name note num ornam rend rest section staff syl tempo
MEI.text: quote seg
MEI.usersymbols: anchoredText
May containEmpty element
Note

When material is omitted because it is illegible or inaudible, <unclear> should be used instead. Similarly, use <damage> if the omission is due to damage and <del> if the omission is because the material is marked as deleted, or otherwise indicated as superfluous or spurious in the copy text by an author, scribe, annotator, or corrector. An indication of how much material has been omitted from the transcription may be recorded in the extent attribute. The unit attribute names the unit used for describing the extent of the gap. The reason attribute gives the reason for omission. Sample values include sampling, irrelevant, cancelled. The resp attribute contains an ID reference to an element containing the name of the editor, transcriber or encoder responsible for the decision not to provide any transcription of the material and hence the application of the <gap> tag. The hand attribute signifies the hand which made the deletion in the case of text omitted from the transcription because of deliberate deletion by an identifiable hand. The cert attribute signifies the degree of certainty ascribed to the identification of the extent of the missing material.

Note

The model of this element is based on the gap element of the Text Encoding Initiative (TEI).

Content model
<content¬†autoPrefix="true">
</content>
    ‚öì
Schema Declaration
element gap
{
   att.common.attributes,
   att.edit.attributes,
   att.extent.attributes,
   att.handIdent.attributes,
   att.reasonIdent.attributes,
   empty
}‚öì

Appendix A.1.41 <genre>

<genre> Term or terms that designate a category characterizing a particular style, form, or content.
Namespacehttp://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0
ModuleMEI.shared
Attributesatt.common (att.basic (@xml:base) (att.id (@xml:id)) ) (att.labelled (@label)) (att.linking (@copyof, @corresp, @follows, @next, @precedes, @prev, @sameas, @synch)) (att.nNumberLike (@n)) (att.responsibility (@resp)) (att.typed (@type) (att.classed (@class)) ) att.authorized (@auth, @auth.uri) (att.canonical (@codedval)) att.bibl (@analog) att.lang (@xml:lang, @translit)
Contained by
‚Äî
May contain
MEI.edittrans: abbr expan
MEI.ptrref: ptr ref
MEI.shared: lb name num rend
MEI.text: q seg
character data
Content model
<content¬†autoPrefix="true">
</content>
    ‚öì
Schema Declaration
element genre
{
   att.common.attributes,
   att.authorized.attributes,
   att.bibl.attributes,
   att.lang.attributes,
   ( text | model.textPhraseLike.limited )*
}‚öì

Appendix A.1.42 <gliss>

<gliss> (glissando) A continuous or sliding movement from one pitch to another, usually indicated by a straight or wavy line.
Namespacehttp://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0
ModuleMEI.cmn
Attributesatt.common (att.basic (@xml:base) (att.id (@xml:id)) ) (att.labelled (@label)) (att.linking (@copyof, @corresp, @follows, @next, @precedes, @prev, @sameas, @synch)) (att.nNumberLike (@n)) (att.responsibility (@resp)) (att.typed (@type) (att.classed (@class)) ) att.gliss.log (att.controlEvent (att.layerIdent (@layer)) (att.partIdent (@part, @partstaff)) (att.plist (@plist)) (att.staffIdent (@staff)) (att.targetEval (@evaluate)) (att.timestamp.log (@tstamp)) (att.timestamp.ges (@tstamp.ges, @tstamp.real)) ) (att.duration.additive (@dur)) (att.startEndId (@endid) (att.startId (@startid)) ) (att.timestamp2.log (@tstamp2)) att.gliss.vis (att.altSym (@altsym)) (att.color (@color)) (att.typography (@fontfam, @fontname, @fontsize, @fontstyle, @fontweight, @letterspacing, @lineheight)) (att.visualOffset (att.visualOffset.ho (@ho)) (att.visualOffset.to (@to)) (att.visualOffset.vo (@vo)) ) (att.visualOffset2 (att.visualOffset2.ho (@startho, @endho)) (att.visualOffset2.to (@startto, @endto)) (att.visualOffset2.vo (@startvo, @endvo)) ) (att.xy (@x, @y)) (att.xy2 (@x2, @y2)) (att.lineRend (@lendsym, @lendsym.size, @lstartsym, @lstartsym.size) (att.lineRend.base (@lform, @lsegs, @lwidth)) ) att.gliss.ges (att.duration.ges (@dur.ges, @dots.ges, @dur.metrical, @dur.ppq, @dur.real, @dur.recip)) (att.timestamp2.ges (@tstamp2.ges, @tstamp2.real)) att.gliss.anl
Member of
model.controlEventLike
Contained by
MEI.cmn: measure
MEI.critapp: lem rdg
MEI.edittrans: abbr add corr damage del expan orig reg sic supplied unclear
May contain
MEI.edittrans: abbr expan
MEI.ptrref: ptr ref
MEI.shared: lb name num rend
MEI.text: q seg
character data
Note

Commonly also called a 'slide'. The term 'glissando' is frequently used to indicate both the case where distinct intermediate pitches are produced (as on the piano) and the case where they are not (as on the trombone), though the latter is sometimes referred to as 'portamento'. The visual appearance of the indicating line may be recorded in the lform and lwidth attributes. The starting point of the glissando may be indicated by either a startid, tstamp, tstamp.ges, or tstamp.real attribute, while the ending point may be recorded by either a dur, dur.ges, endid, or tstamp2 attribute. It is a semantic error not to specify one starting and one ending type of attribute.

Schematron
<sch:rule¬†context="mei:gliss"> <sch:assert¬†test="@startid or @tstamp or @tstamp.ges or @tstamp.real">Must have one of the attributes: startid, tstamp, tstamp.ges or tstamp.real.</sch:assert> <sch:assert¬†test="@dur or @dur.ges or @endid or @tstamp2">Must have one of the attributes: dur, dur.ges, endid, or tstamp2.</sch:assert> </sch:rule>
Content model
<content¬†autoPrefix="true">
</content>
    ‚öì
Schema Declaration
element gliss
{
   att.common.attributes,
   att.gliss.log.attributes,
   att.gliss.vis.attributes,
   att.gliss.ges.attributes,
   att.gliss.anl.attributes,
   ( text | model.textPhraseLike.limited )*
}‚öì

Appendix A.1.43 <graceGrp>

<graceGrp> A container for a sequence of grace notes.
Namespacehttp://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0
ModuleMEI.cmn
Attributesatt.common (att.basic (@xml:base) (att.id (@xml:id)) ) (att.labelled (@label)) (att.linking (@copyof, @corresp, @follows, @next, @precedes, @prev, @sameas, @synch)) (att.nNumberLike (@n)) (att.responsibility (@resp)) (att.typed (@type) (att.classed (@class)) ) att.graceGrp.log (@attach) (att.event (att.layerIdent (@layer)) (att.staffIdent (@staff)) (att.timestamp.ges (@tstamp.ges, @tstamp.real)) (att.timestamp.log (@tstamp)) ) (att.graced (@grace, @grace.time)) att.graceGrp.vis (att.color (@color)) att.graceGrp.gesatt.graceGrp.anl

model.eventLike.cmn

Schematron
<sch:rule¬†context="mei:graceGrp[@grace]"> <sch:assert¬†test="not(descendant::mei:*[@grace])">The grace attribute is not allowed on descendants of a graceGrp with a grace attribute.</sch:assert> </sch:rule>
