Appendix A.4.50 data.FRBRRELATIONSHIP

data.FRBRRELATIONSHIP¬†Relationships between FRBR entities.
ModuleMEI.frbr
Used by
Content model
<content¬†autoPrefix="true">
¬†<valList¬†type="closed"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="hasAbridgement"
¬†¬†¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Target is an abridgement, condensation, or expurgation of the current entity.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="isAbridgementOf"
¬†¬†¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Reciprocal relationship of hasAbridgement.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="hasAdaptation"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Target is an adaptation, paraphrase, free translation, variation (music),
¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† harmonization (music), or fantasy (music) of the current entity.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="isAdaptationOf"
¬†¬†¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Reciprocal relationship of hasAdaptation.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="hasAlternate"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Target is an alternate format or simultaneously released edition of the current
¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† entity.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="isAlternateOf"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Reciprocal relationship of hasAlternate.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="hasArrangement"
¬†¬†¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Target is an arrangement (music) of the current entity.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="isArrangementOf"
¬†¬†¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Reciprocal relationship of hasArrangement.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="hasComplement"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Target is a cadenza, libretto, choreography, ending for unfinished work, incidental
¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† music, or musical setting of a text of the current entity.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="isComplementOf"
¬†¬†¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Reciprocal relationship of hasComplement.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="hasEmbodiment"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Target is a physical embodiment of the current abstract entity; describes the
¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† expression-to-manifestation relationship.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="isEmbodimentOf"
¬†¬†¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Reciprocal relationship of hasEmbodiment.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="hasExemplar"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Target is an exemplar of the class of things represented by the current entity;
¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† describes the manifestation-to-item relationship.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="isExemplarOf"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Reciprocal relationship of hasExamplar.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="hasImitation"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Target is a parody, imitation, or travesty of the current entity.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="isImitationOf"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Reciprocal relationship of hasImitation.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="hasPart"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Target is a chapter, section, part, etc.; volume of a multivolume manifestation;
¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† volume/issue of serial; intellectual part of a multi-part work; illustration for a text;
¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† sound aspect of a film; soundtrack for a film on separate medium; soundtrack for a film
¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† embedded in film; monograph in a series; physical component of a particular copy; the
¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† binding of a book of the current entity.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="isPartOf"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Reciprocal relationship of hasPart.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="hasRealization"
¬†¬†¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Target is a realization of the current entity; describes the work-to-expression
¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† relationship.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="isRealizationOf"
¬†¬†¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Reciprocal relationship of hasRealization.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="hasReconfiguration"
¬†¬†¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Target has been reconfigured: bound with, split into, extracted from the current
¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† entity.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="isReconfigurationOf"
¬†¬†¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Reciprocal relationship of hasReconfiguration.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="hasReproduction"
¬†¬†¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Target is a reproduction, microreproduction, macroreproduction, reprint,
¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† photo-offset reprint, or facsimile of the current entity.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="isReproductionOf"
¬†¬†¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Reciprocal relationship of hasReproduction.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="hasRevision"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Target is a revised edition, enlarged edition, or new state (graphic) of the current
¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† entity.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="isRevisionOf"¬†rend="add">

¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="hasSuccessor"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Target is a sequel or succeeding work of the current entity.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="isSuccessorOf"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Reciprocal relationship of hasSuccessor.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="hasSummarization"
¬†¬†¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Target is a digest or abstract of the current entity.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="isSummarizationOf"
¬†¬†¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Reciprocal relationship of hasSummarization.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="hasSupplement"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Target is an index, concordance, teacher‚Äôs guide, gloss, supplement, or appendix of
¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† the current entity.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="isSupplementOf"
¬†¬†¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Reciprocal relationship of hasSupplement.</desc>

¬†¬†¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Target is a dramatization, novelization, versification, or screenplay of the current
¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† entity.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="isTransformationOf"
¬†¬†¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Reciprocal relationship of hasTransformation.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>

¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† entity.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="isTranslationOf"
¬†¬†¬†rend="add">

¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†</valList>

    ‚öì

data.FRBRRELATIONSHIP =
   "hasAbridgement"

¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="m"¬†rend="add">

Appendix A.4.52 data.GRACE

data.GRACE¬†Do grace notes get time from the current (acc) or previous (unacc) one?
ModuleMEI
Used by
Content model
<content¬†autoPrefix="true">
¬†<valList¬†type="closed"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="acc"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Time "stolen" from following note.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="unacc"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Time "stolen" from previous note.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="unknown"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">No interpretation regarding performed value of grace note.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†</valList>
</content>
    ‚öì
Declaration
data.GRACE = "acc" | "unacc" | "unknown"‚öì

data.HEADSHAPE.list¬†Enumerated note head shapes.
ModuleMEI
Used by
data.HEADSHAPE
Content model
<content¬†autoPrefix="true">
¬†<valList¬†type="closed"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="quarter"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Filled, rotated oval (Unicode 1D158).</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="half"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Unfilled, rotated oval (Unicode 1D157).</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="whole"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Unfilled, rotated oval (Unicode 1D15D).</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="backslash"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Unfilled backslash (~ reflection of Unicode 1D10D).</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="circle"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Unfilled circle (Unicode 25CB).</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="+"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Plus sign (Unicode 1D144).</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="diamond"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Unfilled diamond (Unicode 1D1B9).</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="isotriangle"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Unfilled isosceles triangle (Unicode 1D148).</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="oval"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Unfilled, unrotated oval (Unicode 2B2D).</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="piewedge"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Unfilled downward-pointing wedge (Unicode 1D154).</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="rectangle"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Unfilled rectangle (Unicode 25AD).</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="rtriangle"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Unfilled right triangle (Unicode 1D14A).</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="semicircle"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Unfilled semi-circle (Unicode 1D152).</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="slash"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Unfilled slash (~ Unicode 1D10D).</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="square"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Unfilled square (Unicode 1D146).</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="x"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">X (Unicode 1D143).</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†</valList>
</content>
    ‚öì
Declaration
data.HEADSHAPE.list =
   "quarter"
 |¬†"half"
 |¬†"whole"
 |¬†"backslash"
 |¬†"circle"
 |¬†"+"
 |¬†"diamond"
 |¬†"isotriangle"
 |¬†"oval"
 |¬†"piewedge"
 |¬†"rectangle"
 |¬†"rtriangle"
 |¬†"semicircle"
 |¬†"slash"
 |¬†"square"
 |¬†"x"‚öì

Appendix A.4.55 data.HEXNUM

data.HEXNUM¬†Hexadecimal number.
ModuleMEI
Used by
data.HEADSHAPE
Declaration
data.HEXNUM = string { pattern = "(#x|U\+)[A-F0-9]+" }‚öì

Appendix A.4.56 data.HORIZONTALALIGNMENT

data.HORIZONTALALIGNMENT¬†Data values for attributes that capture horizontal alignment.
ModuleMEI
Used by
Content model
<content¬†autoPrefix="true">
¬†<valList¬†type="closed"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="left"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Left aligned.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="right"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Right aligned.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="center"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Centered.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="justify"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Left and right aligned.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†</valList>
</content>
    ‚öì
Declaration
data.HORIZONTALALIGNMENT = "left" | "right" | "center" | "justify"‚öì

Appendix A.4.57 data.INTERVAL.HARMONIC

data.INTERVAL.HARMONIC¬†A token indicating diatonic interval quality and size.
ModuleMEI
Used by
Declaration
data.INTERVAL.HARMONIC = token { pattern = "[AdMmP][0-9]+" }‚öì

Appendix A.4.58 data.INTERVAL.MELODIC

data.INTERVAL.MELODIC¬†A token indicating direction of the interval but not its precise value, a diatonic interval (with optional direction and quality), or a decimal value in half steps. Decimal values are permitted to accommodate micro-tuning.
ModuleMEI
Used by
Declaration
data.INTERVAL.MELODIC =
   token { pattern = "u|d|s|n|sd|su" }
 |¬†token { pattern = "(\+|\-)?([AdMmP])?[0-9]+" }
 |¬†token { pattern = "(\+|\-)?\d+(\.\d+)?hs" }‚öì
Note
Interval direction only:
  • u = up/higher,
  • d = down/lower,
  • s = same,
  • n = neutral/unknown,
  • sd = same or lower (but not higher),
  • su = same or higher (but not lower)
Interval direction, quality, and size:
  • optional sign,
  • optional quality indicator:
    • A = augmented,
    • d = diminished,
    • M = major,
    • m = minor,
    • P = perfect
  • integer value
Interval in half steps:
  • optional sign,
  • decimal value
  • "hs"

Appendix A.4.59 data.ISODATE

data.ISODATE¬†ISO date formats.
ModuleMEI
Used by
Declaration
data.ISODATE =
   xsd:date
 |¬†xsd:gYear
 |¬†xsd:gMonth
 |¬†xsd:gDay
 |¬†xsd:gYearMonth
 |¬†xsd:gMonthDay
 |¬†xsd:time
 |¬†xsd:dateTime
 |¬†token { pattern = "[0-9.,DHMPRSTWYZ/:+\-]+" }‚öì

Appendix A.4.60 data.ISOTIME

data.ISOTIME¬†ISO 24-hour time format: HH:MM:SS.ss, i.e., [0-9][0-9]:[0-9][0-9]:[0-9][0-9](\.?[0-9]*)?.
ModuleMEI
Used by
Declaration
data.ISOTIME = xsd:time‚öì

Appendix A.4.61 data.KEYFIFTHS

data.KEYFIFTHS¬†Indicates the location of the tonic in the circle of fifths.
ModuleMEI
Used by
Declaration
data.KEYFIFTHS = token { pattern = "mixed|0|([1-9]|1[0-2])[f|s]" }‚öì

Appendix A.4.62 data.LAYERSCHEME

data.LAYERSCHEME¬†Indicates how stems should be drawn when more than one layer is present and stem directions are not indicated on the notes/chords themselves. '1' indicates that there is only a single layer on a staff. '2o' means there are two layers with opposing stems. '2f' indicates two 'free' layers; that is, opposing stems will be drawn unless one of the layers has 'space'. In that case, stem direction in the remaining layer will be determined as if there were only one layer. '3o' and '3f' are analogous to '2o' and '2f' with three layers allowed.
ModuleMEI
Used by
Content model
<content¬†autoPrefix="true">
¬†<valList¬†type="closed"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="1"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Single layer.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="2o"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Two layers with opposing stems.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="2f"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Two layers with 'floating' stems.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="3o"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Three layers with opposing stems.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="3f"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Three layers with 'floating' stems.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†</valList>
</content>
    ‚öì
Declaration
data.LAYERSCHEME = "1" | "2o" | "2f" | "3o" | "3f"‚öì

Appendix A.4.63 data.LIGATUREFORM

data.LIGATUREFORM¬†Ligature forms.
ModuleMEI
Used by
Content model
<content¬†autoPrefix="true">
¬†<valList¬†type="closed"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="recta"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Notes are "squeezed" together.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="obliqua"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Individual notes are replaced by an oblique figure.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†</valList>
</content>
    ‚öì
Declaration
data.LIGATUREFORM = "recta" | "obliqua"‚öì

<content¬†autoPrefix="true">
¬†<valList¬†type="closed"¬†rend="add">

¬†¬†</valItem>

¬†¬†</valItem>

¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Straight, uninterrupted line.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="wavy"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Undulating line.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†</valList>

    ‚öì

Appendix A.4.65 data.LINESTARTENDSYMBOL

data.LINESTARTENDSYMBOL¬†Symbol that may begin/end a line.
ModuleMEI
Used by
Content model
<content¬†autoPrefix="true">
¬†<valList¬†type="closed"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="angledown"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">90 degree turn down (similar to Unicode 231D at end of line, 231C at start).</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="angleup"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">90 degree turn up (similar to Unicode 231F at end of line, 231E at start).</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="angleright"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">90 degree turn right (syntactic sugar for "angledown" for vertical or angled
¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† lines).</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="angleleft"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">90 degree turn left (syntactic sugar for "angleup" for vertical or angled
¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† lines).</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="arrow"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Filled, triangular arrowhead (similar to Unicode U+25C0 or SMuFL U+EB78).</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="arrowopen"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Open triangular arrowhead (similar to Unicode U+02C3 or SMuFL U+EB8A).</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="arrowwhite"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Unfilled, triangular arrowhead (similar to Unicode U+25C1 or SMuFL U+EB82).</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="harpoonleft"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Harpoon-shaped arrowhead left of line (similar to arrowhead of Unicode
¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† U+21BD).</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="harpoonright"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Harpoon-shaped arrowhead right of line (similar to arrowhead of Unicode
¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† U+21BC).</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="H"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Hauptstimme (Unicode U+1D1A6 or SMuFL U+E860).</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="N"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Nebenstimme (Unicode U+1D1A7 or SMuFL U+E861).</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="Th"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Theme (SMuFL U+E864).</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>

¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Theme, retrograde (SMuFL U+E865).</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="ThRetroInv"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Theme, retrograde inversion (SMuFL U+E866).</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="ThInv"¬†rend="add">

¬†¬†</valItem>

¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="TInv"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Theme, inverted (SMuFL U+E869).</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="CH"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Choralemelodie (SMuFL U+E86A).</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="RH"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Hauptrhythmus (SMuFL U+E86B).</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="none"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">No start/end symbol.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†</valList>

    ‚öì

 |¬†"harpoonright"

 |¬†"none"‚öì

Appendix A.4.66 data.LINEWIDTH

data.LINEWIDTH¬†Datatype of line width measurements.
ModuleMEI
Used by
Declaration
data.LINEWIDTH = data.LINEWIDTHTERM | data.MEASUREMENTUNSIGNED‚öì

Appendix A.4.67 data.LINEWIDTHTERM

data.LINEWIDTHTERM¬†Relative width of a line.
ModuleMEI
Used by
data.LINEWIDTH
Content model
<content¬†autoPrefix="true">
¬†<valList¬†type="closed"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="narrow"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Default line width.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="medium"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Twice as wide as narrow.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="wide"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Twice as wide as medium.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†</valList>
</content>
    ‚öì
Declaration
data.LINEWIDTHTERM = "narrow" | "medium" | "wide"‚öì

Appendix A.4.68 data.MEASUREBEAT

data.MEASUREBEAT¬†A count of measures plus a beat location, i.e., [0-9]+m *\+ *[0-9]+(\.?[0-9]*)?. The measure count is the number of bar lines crossed by the event, while the beat location is a timestamp expressed as a beat with an optional fractional part. For example, "1m+3.5" indicates a point in the next measure on the second half of beat 3. The measure number must be in the range of 0 to the number of remaining measures, while the beat number must be in the range from 0 to the numerator of the time signature plus 1. For example, in 6/8 the beat number must be within the range from 0 (the left bar line) to 7 (the right bar line). A value with a measure number of "0", such as "0m+2", indicates a point within the current measure.
ModuleMEI
Used by
Declaration
data.MEASUREBEAT = token { pattern = "([0-9]+m\s*\+\s*)?[0-9]+(\.?[0-9]*)?" }‚öì

Appendix A.4.69 data.MEASUREBEATOFFSET

data.MEASUREBEATOFFSET¬†A count of measures plus a beat location, i.e., (\+|-)?[0-9]+m\+[0-9]+(\.?[0-9]*)?. The measure count is the number of bar lines crossed by the event, while the beat location is a timestamp expressed as a beat with an optional fractional part. The measure number must be in the range of preceding measures to the number of remaining measures. A value with a positive measure number, such as "1m+3", indicates a point in the following measure, while a value with a negative measure number, such as "-1m+3", marks a point in the preceding measure. The beat number must be in the range from 0 to the numerator of the time signature plus 1. For example, in 6/8 the beat number must be within the range from 0 (the left bar line) to 7 (the right bar line). A value with a measure number of "0", such as "0m+2", indicates a point within the current measure.
ModuleMEI
Used by
Declaration
data.MEASUREBEATOFFSET =
   token { pattern = "(\+|-)?[0-9]+m\+[0-9]+(\.[0-9]*)?" }‚öì

Appendix A.4.70 data.MEASUREMENTFONTSIGNED

data.MEASUREMENTFONTSIGNED¬†Measurement expressed relative to properties of the current font, in analogy to the respective CSS length units. Unlike data.MEASUREMENTFONTUNSIGNED, both positive and negative values are allowed.
ModuleMEI
Used by
data.MEASUREMENTTYPOGRAPHYSIGNED
Declaration
data.MEASUREMENTFONTSIGNED =
   token { pattern = "(\+|-)?\d+(\.\d+)?(ch|em|ex)?" }‚öì

Appendix A.4.71 data.MEASUREMENTFONTUNSIGNED

data.MEASUREMENTFONTUNSIGNED¬†Measurement expressed relative to properties of the current font, in analogy to the respective CSS length units. Unlike data.MEASUREMENTFONTUNSIGNED, only positive values are allowed.
ModuleMEI
Used by
data.MEASUREMENTTYPOGRAPHYUNSIGNED
Declaration
data.MEASUREMENTFONTUNSIGNED = token { pattern = "\d+(\.\d+)?(ch|em|ex)?" }‚öì

Appendix A.4.72 data.MEASUREMENTSIGNED

data.MEASUREMENTSIGNED¬†Measurement expressed in real-world (e.g., centimeters, millimeters, inches, points, picas, or pixels) or virtual units (vu). 'vu' is the default value. Unlike data.MEASUREMENTUNSIGNED, in which only positive values are allowed, both positive and negative values are permitted.
ModuleMEI
Used by
data.MEASUREMENTTYPOGRAPHYSIGNED
Declaration
data.MEASUREMENTSIGNED =
   token { pattern = "(\+|-)?\d+(\.\d+)?(cm|mm|in|pt|pc|px|vu)?" }‚öì

Appendix A.4.73 data.MEASUREMENTTYPOGRAPHYSIGNED

data.MEASUREMENTTYPOGRAPHYSIGNED¬†Measurements used for typographical features. Unlike data.MEASUREMENTTYPOGRAPHYSIGNED, both positive and negative values are allowed.
ModuleMEI
Used by
Declaration
data.MEASUREMENTTYPOGRAPHYSIGNED =
   data.MEASUREMENTFONTSIGNED | data.MEASUREMENTSIGNED‚öì

Appendix A.4.74 data.MEASUREMENTTYPOGRAPHYUNSIGNED

data.MEASUREMENTTYPOGRAPHYUNSIGNED¬†Measurements used for typographical features. Unlike data.MEASUREMENTTYPOGRAPHYSIGNED, only positive values are allowed.
ModuleMEI
Used by
Declaration
data.MEASUREMENTTYPOGRAPHYUNSIGNED =
   data.MEASUREMENTFONTUNSIGNED | data.MEASUREMENTUNSIGNED‚öì

Appendix A.4.75 data.MEASUREMENTUNSIGNED

data.MEASUREMENTUNSIGNED¬†Measurement expressed in real-world (e.g., centimeters, millimeters, inches, points, picas, or pixels) or virtual units (vu). 'vu' is the default value. Unlike data.MEASUREMENTSIGNED, only positive values are allowed.
ModuleMEI
Used by
data.LINEWIDTH data.MEASUREMENTTYPOGRAPHYUNSIGNED
Declaration
data.MEASUREMENTUNSIGNED =
   token { pattern = "(\+)?\d+(\.\d+)?(cm|mm|in|pt|pc|px|vu)?" }‚öì

Appendix A.4.76 data.MELODICFUNCTION

data.MELODICFUNCTION¬†Indication of melodic function, i.e., anticipation, lower neighbor, escape tone, etc.
ModuleMEI
Used by
Content model
<content¬†autoPrefix="true">
¬†<valList¬†type="closed"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="aln"¬†rend="add">

¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="et"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Escape tone.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>

¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Lower neighbor.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="ped"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Pedal tone.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="rep"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Repeated tone.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="ret"¬†rend="add">

¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="23ret"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">2-3 retardation.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="78ret"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">7-8 retardation.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="sus"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Suspension.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>

¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">9-8 suspension.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="76sus"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">7-6 suspension.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="un"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Upper neighbor.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="un7"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Upper neighbor (7th added to the chord).</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="upt"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Unaccented passing tone.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="upt7"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Unaccented passing tone (7th added to the chord).</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†</valList>
</content>
    ‚öì
Declaration
data.MELODICFUNCTION =
   "aln"
 |¬†"ant"

 |¬†"arp7"

Appendix A.4.78 data.METERFORM

data.METERFORM¬†Contains an indication of how a meter signature should be rendered.
ModuleMEI
Used by
Content model
<content¬†autoPrefix="true">
¬†<valList¬†type="closed"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="num"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Show only the number of beats.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="denomsym"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">The lower number in the meter signature is replaced by a note symbol.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="norm"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Meter signature rendered using traditional numeric values.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="sym+norm"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Meter signature rendered using both the symbol and the traditional numeric values.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="invis"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Meter signature not rendered.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†</valList>
</content>
    ‚öì
Declaration
data.METERFORM = "num" | "denomsym" | "norm" | "sym+norm" | "invis"‚öì

¬†¬†</valItem>

Appendix A.4.80 data.MIDIVALUE

data.MIDIVALUE¬†Generic MIDI value. One-based values must be followed by a lower-case letter "o".
ModuleMEI
Used by
Declaration
data.MIDIVALUE =
   token { pattern = "0|([1-9]|[1-9][0-9]|1([0-1][0-9]|2[0-7]))o?|128o" }‚öì

Appendix A.4.85 data.MODSRELATIONSHIP

ModuleMEI
Used by
Content model
<content¬†autoPrefix="true">
¬†<valList¬†type="closed"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="preceding"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Temporal predecessor of the resource.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="succeeding"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Temporal successor to the resource.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="original"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Original form of the resource.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="host"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Parent containing the resource.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>

¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="otherVersion"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Version of the resource‚Äôs intellectual content not changed enough to be a different
¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† work.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="otherFormat"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Version of the resource in a different physical format.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="isReferencedBy"
¬†¬†¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Published bibliographic description, review, abstract, or index of the resource's
¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† content.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="references"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Cited or referred to in the resource.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†</valList>
</content>
    ‚öì

   "preceding"
 |¬†"succeeding"
 |¬†"original"
 |¬†"host"
 |¬†"constituent"
 |¬†"otherVersion"
 |¬†"otherFormat"
 |¬†"isReferencedBy"
 |¬†"references"‚öì

¬†<valList¬†type="closed"¬†rend="add">

Appendix A.4.90 data.NONSTAFFPLACE

data.NONSTAFFPLACE¬†Non-staff location.
ModuleMEI
Used by
data.PLACEMENT
Content model
<content¬†autoPrefix="true">
¬†<valList¬†type="closed"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="botmar"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">At the foot of the page.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="topmar"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">At the top of the page.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="leftmar"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">At the left of the page.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="rightmar"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">At the right of the page.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="facing"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">On the opposite, <abbr>i.e.</abbr>, facing, page.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="overleaf"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">On the other side of the leaf.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="end"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">At the end of this division; <abbr>e.g.</abbr>, chapter, volume, etc.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="inter"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Within a line text; <abbr>i.e.</abbr>, an insertion.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="intra"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Between the lines of text, less exact than "sub" or "super".</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="super"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Above a line of text, more exact than "intra(linear)". Do not confuse with
¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† superscript rendition.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="sub"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Below a line of text, more exact than "intra(linear)". Do not confuse with subscript
¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† rendition.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="inspace"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">In a predefined space; <abbr>i.e.</abbr>, that left by an earlier scribe.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="superimposed"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Obscures original text; <abbr>e.g.</abbr>, via overstrike, addition of new writing surface
¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† material, etc.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†</valList>
</content>
    ‚öì
Declaration
data.NONSTAFFPLACE =
   "botmar"
 |¬†"topmar"
 |¬†"leftmar"
 |¬†"rightmar"
 |¬†"facing"
 |¬†"overleaf"
 |¬†"end"
 |¬†"inter"
 |¬†"intra"
 |¬†"super"
 |¬†"sub"
 |¬†"inspace"
 |¬†"superimposed"‚öì

Appendix A.4.92 data.NOTEHEADMODIFIER

data.NOTEHEADMODIFIER¬†Captures any notehead "modifiers"; that is, symbols added to the notehead, such as slashes, lines, text, and enclosures, etc.
ModuleMEI
Used by
Declaration
data.NOTEHEADMODIFIER = data.NOTEHEADMODIFIER.list | data.NOTEHEADMODIFIER.pat‚öì

¬†<valList¬†type="closed"¬†rend="add">

¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Slash (upper right to lower left).</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="backslash"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Backslash (upper left to lower right).</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>

¬†¬†</valItem>

¬†¬†</valItem>

¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Enclosing circle.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>

¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†</valList>

    ‚öì

   "slash"
 |¬†"backslash"

Appendix A.4.94 data.NOTEHEADMODIFIER.pat

data.NOTEHEADMODIFIER.pat¬†Captures text rendered in the center of the notehead.
ModuleMEI
Used by
data.NOTEHEADMODIFIER
Declaration
data.NOTEHEADMODIFIER.pat =
   string { pattern = "centertext\((A|B|C|D|E|F|G)(f|‚ô≠|n|‚ôÆ|s|‚ôØ)?\)" }
 |¬†string { pattern = "centertext\(H(s|‚ôØ)?\)" }‚öì

Appendix A.4.95 data.OCTAVE

data.OCTAVE¬†Oct attribute values. The default values conform to Acoustical Society of America representation. Read, p. 44.
ModuleMEI
Used by
Declaration
data.OCTAVE = xsd:nonNegativeInteger { maxInclusive = "9" }‚öì

Appendix A.4.96 data.OCTAVE.DIS

data.OCTAVE.DIS¬†The amount of octave displacement; that is, '8' (as in '8va' for 1 octave), '15' (for 2 octaves), or rarely '22' (for 3 octaves).
ModuleMEI
Used by
Declaration
data.OCTAVE.DIS = xsd:positiveInteger { pattern = "8|15|22" }‚öì

Appendix A.4.97 data.ORIENTATION

data.ORIENTATION¬†Rotation or reflection of base symbol values.
ModuleMEI
Used by
Declaration
data.ORIENTATION = token { pattern = "reversed|90CW|90CCW" }‚öì

Appendix A.4.98 data.ORNAM.cmn

data.ORNAM.cmn¬†CMN ornam attribute values: A = appogiatura (upper neighbor); a = acciaccatura (lower neighbor); b = bebung; I = ascending slide; i = descending slide; k = delayed turn; K = 5-note turn; m = mordent (alternation with lower neighbor); M = inverted mordent (alternation with upper neighbor); N = Nachschlag (upper neighbor); n = Nachschlag (lower neighbor); S = turn; s = inverted turn; t = trill commencing on auxiliary note; T = trill commencing on principal note; O = generic / unspecified ornament.
ModuleMEI.cmnOrnaments
Used by
Declaration
data.ORNAM.cmn =
   token
   {
      pattern = "[A|a|b|I|i|K|k|M|m|N|n|S|s|T|t|O]|(A|a|S|s|K|k)?(T|t|M|m)(I|i|S|s)?"
   }‚öì

Appendix A.4.99 data.PAGE.PANELS

data.PAGE.PANELS¬†The number of panels per page.
ModuleMEI
Used by
Declaration
data.PAGE.PANELS =
   xsd:positiveInteger { minInclusive = "1" maxInclusive = "2" }‚öì

Appendix A.4.100 data.PEDALSTYLE

data.PEDALSTYLE¬†Styling of piano pedal marks.
ModuleMEI
Used by
Content model
<content¬†autoPrefix="true">
¬†<valList¬†type="closed"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="line"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Continuous line with start and end positions rendered by vertical bars and bounces
¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† shown by upward-pointing "blips".</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="pedline"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Pedal down and half pedal rendered with "Ped." followed by a line with
¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† end position rendered by vertical bars and bounces shown by upward-pointing "blips".</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="pedstar"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Pedal down and half pedal rendered with "Ped.", pedal up rendered by "*", pedal
¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† "bounce" rendered with "* Ped.".</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="altpedstar"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Pedal up and down indications same as with "pedstar", but bounce is rendered with
¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† "Ped." only.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†</valList>
</content>
    ‚öì
Declaration
data.PEDALSTYLE = "line" | "pedline" | "pedstar" | "altpedstar"‚öì

Appendix A.4.101 data.PERCENT

data.PERCENT¬†Positive decimal number plus '%', i.e., [0-9]+(\.?[0-9]*)?\%.
ModuleMEI
Used by
data.FONTSIZE data.PGSCALE
Declaration
data.PERCENT = token { pattern = "[0-9]+(\.?[0-9]*)?%" }‚öì

Appendix A.4.102 data.PERCENT.LIMITED

data.PERCENT.LIMITED¬†Positive decimal number between 0 and 100, followed by a percent sign "%".
ModuleMEI
Used by
Declaration
data.PERCENT.LIMITED =
   token { pattern = "(([0-9]|[1-9][0-9])(\.[0-9]+)?|100(\.0+)?)%" }‚öì

Appendix A.4.103 data.PERCENT.LIMITED.SIGNED

data.PERCENT.LIMITED.SIGNED¬†Positive decimal number between -100 and 100, followed by a percent sign "%".
ModuleMEI
Used by
Declaration
data.PERCENT.LIMITED.SIGNED =
   token { pattern = "(\+|-)?(([0-9]|[1-9][0-9])(\.[0-9]+)?|100(\.0+)?)%" }‚öì

Appendix A.4.104 data.PGSCALE

data.PGSCALE¬†Page scale factor; a percentage of the values in page.height and page.width.
ModuleMEI
Used by
Declaration
data.PGSCALE = data.PERCENT‚öì

ModuleMEI

Declaration
data.PITCHCLASS = xsd:nonNegativeInteger { maxInclusive = "11" }‚öì

Appendix A.4.106 data.PITCHNAME

data.PITCHNAME¬†The pitch names (gamut) used within a single octave. The default values conform to Acoustical Society of America representation.
ModuleMEI
Used by
Declaration
data.PITCHNAME = token { pattern = "[a-g]" }‚öì

ModuleMEI
Used by
Declaration
data.PITCHNAME.GES = token { pattern = "[a-g]|none" }‚öì

Content model
<content¬†autoPrefix="true">
¬†<valList¬†type="closed"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="none"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">No rotation.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="down"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Rotated 180 degrees.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>

¬†¬†</valItem>

¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†</valList>

    ‚öì

Declaration

Appendix A.4.114 data.SLUR

data.SLUR¬†i=initial, m=medial, t=terminal. Number is used to match endpoints of the slur when slurs are nested or overlap.
ModuleMEI
Used by
Declaration
data.SLUR = token { pattern = "[i|m|t][1-6]" }‚öì
Example
<note¬†slur="i1 i2"/> <note¬†slur="t1"/> <note¬†slur="t2"/> ¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†

Appendix A.4.118 data.STAFFLOC

data.STAFFLOC¬†Staff location. The value '0' indicates the bottom line of the current staff; positive values are used for positions above the bottom line and negative values for the positions below. For example, in treble clef, 1 = F4, 2 = G4, 3 = A4, etc. and -1 = D4, -2 = C4, and so on.
ModuleMEI
Used by
Declaration
data.STAFFLOC = xsd:integer‚öì

Appendix A.4.119 data.STAFFREL

<content¬†autoPrefix="true">
¬†<valList¬†type="closed"¬†rend="add">

¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Surrounded by single quotes.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>

¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Surrounded by double quotes.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="italic"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Italicized (slanted to right).</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="oblique"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Oblique (slanted to left).</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>

¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Small capitals.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="bold"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Relative font weight.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="bolder"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Relative font weight.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="lighter"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Relative font weight.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="box"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Enclosed in box.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="circle"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Enclosed in ellipse/circle.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="dbox"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Enclosed in diamond.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="tbox"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Enclosed in triangle.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="bslash"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Struck through by '\' (back slash).</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="fslash"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Struck through by '/' (forward slash).</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="line-through"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Struck through by '-'; may be qualified to indicate multiple parallel lines, <abbr>e.g.</abbr>,
¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† line-through(2).</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="none"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Not rendered, invisible.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="overline"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Line above the text; may be qualified to indicate multiple parallel lines, <abbr>e.g.</abbr>,
¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† overline(3).</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="overstrike"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Use for deleted text fully or partially obscured by other text (such as 'XXXXX') or
¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† musical symbols (such as notes, rests, etc.).</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="strike"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Struck through by '-'; equivalent to line-through; may be qualified to indicate
¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† multiple parallel lines, <abbr>e.g.</abbr>, strike(3).</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="sub"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Subscript.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="sup"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Superscript.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="superimpose"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Use for added text or musical symbols that fully or partially obscure text from an
¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† earlier writing stage.</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="underline"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Underlined; may be qualified to indicate multiple parallel lines, <abbr>e.g.</abbr>,
¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† underline(2).</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="x-through"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Crossed-out; equivalent to 'bslash' (\) plus 'fslash' (/); that is, a hand-written
¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† 'X'; may be qualified to indicate multiple parallel lines, <abbr>e.g.</abbr>, x-through(2).</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="ltr"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Left-to-right (BIDI embed).</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="rtl"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Right-to-left (BIDI embed).</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="lro"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Left-to-right (BIDI override).</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†¬†<valItem¬†ident="rlo"¬†rend="add">
¬†¬†¬†<desc¬†xml:lang="en">Right-to-left (BIDI override).</desc>
¬†¬†</valItem>
¬†</valList>
</content>
    ‚öì
Declaration
data.TEXTRENDITIONLIST =
   "quote"
 |¬†"quotedbl"
 |¬†"italic"
 |¬†"oblique"
 |¬†"smcaps"
 |¬†"bold"
 |¬†"bolder"
 |¬†"lighter"
 |¬†"box"
 |¬†"circle"
 |¬†"dbox"
 |¬†"tbox"
 |¬†"bslash"
 |¬†"fslash"
 |¬†"line-through"
 |¬†"none"
 |¬†"overline"
 |¬†"overstrike"
 |¬†"strike"
 |¬†"sub"
 |¬†"sup"
 |¬†"superimpose"
 |¬†"underline"
 |¬†"x-through"
 |¬†"ltr"
 |¬†"rtl"
 |¬†"lro"
 |¬†"rlo"‚öì

      text,

      fTrem*,

      mRpt*,
      mRest*,
      mSpace*,

      note*,
      num*,
      octave*,
      ornam*,

      ptr*,

      rest*,
      sb*,

      seg*,
      slur*,

      tempo*,

      trill*,

Appendix A.5 Constraints

Schematron(value check for measure count) Checks if the given count exists in the meter.
<sch:rule¬†context="crapp:measure[@count]|crapp:range[@count]"> <sch:let¬†name="meterCount" ¬†value="./ancestor::crapp:crApp/crapp:setting//crapp:meter/@count"/> <sch:let¬†name="meterUnit" ¬†value="./ancestor::crapp:crApp/crapp:setting//crapp:meter/@unit"/> <sch:report¬†role="fatal" ¬†test="./@count/number() gt $meterCount/number()">Unavailable count! The meter is <sch:value-of¬†select="$meterCount"/>/<sch:value-of¬†select="$meterUnit"/>.</sch:report> </sch:rule>
Schematron(value check for part combination) Checks if the named parts at a remark are redundant, e.g., if the part groupis called also.
<sch:rule¬†context="crapp:remark//crapp:part"> <sch:let¬†name="partVal"¬†value="./text()"/> <sch:let¬†name="partGrpVals" ¬†value="ancestor::crapp:remark//crapp:partGrp/text()"/> <sch:report¬†test=".[ancestor::crapp:crApp/crapp:setting//crapp:part[@xml:id = $partVal]/ancestor::crapp:partGrp[@xml:id][@xml:id = ($partGrpVals)]]" ¬†role="warning"> ¬†<sch:value-of¬†select="$partVal"/> is part of <sch:value-of¬†select="($partGrpVals)[last()]"/>. A second call might be redundant.</sch:report> </sch:rule>
Schematron(value check for part group combination) Checks if the named part groups at a remark are redundant, e.g., if the parent or ancestor group is called also.
<sch:rule¬†context="crapp:remark//crapp:partGrp"> <sch:let¬†name="partGrpVal"¬†value="./text()"/> <sch:let¬†name="partGrpVals" ¬†value="ancestor::crapp:remark//crapp:partGrp[not(text() = $partGrpVal)]/text()"/> <sch:report¬†test="ancestor::crapp:crApp/crapp:setting//crapp:partGrp[@xml:id = $partGrpVal]/ancestor::crapp:partGrp[@xml:id][@xml:id = ($partGrpVals)]" ¬†role="warning"> ¬†<sch:value-of¬†select="$partGrpVal"/> is part of <sch:value-of¬†select="($partGrpVals)[last()]"/>. A second call might be redundant.</sch:report> </sch:rule>
Schematron(set namespace) Declaration of namespaces for schematron.
<sch:ns¬†uri="http://baumann-digital.de/ns/crApp"/> <sch:ns¬†prefix="crapp" ¬†uri="http://baumann-digital.de/ns/crApp"/> <sch:ns¬†prefix="mei" ¬†uri="http://www.music-encoding.org/ns/mei"/> <sch:ns¬†prefix="tei" ¬†uri="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"/>
Schematron(value check for setting) Checks if the used values are defined somwhere in the <setting> element.
<sch:schema¬†queryBinding="xslt2"> <sch:ns¬†uri="http://baumann-digital.de/ns/crApp" ¬†prefix="crapp"/> <xsl:function¬†name="functx:is-value-in-sequence" ¬†as="xs:boolean"> ¬†<xsl:param¬†name="value" ¬†¬†as="xs:anyAtomicType?"/> ¬†<xsl:param¬†name="seq" ¬†¬†as="xs:anyAtomicType*"/> ¬†<xsl:sequence¬†select="$value = $seq"/> </xsl:function> <xsl:function¬†name="crapp:checkValues"> ¬†<xsl:param¬†name="elem"¬†as="node()"/> ¬†<xsl:param¬†name="attName"¬†as="xs:string"/> ¬†<xsl:variable¬†name="lang" ¬†¬†select="$elem/ancestor::crapp:setting/crapp:language/@codedval"/> ¬†<xsl:variable¬†name="elemName" ¬†¬†select="local-name($elem)"/> ¬†<xsl:variable¬†name="elemText" ¬†¬†select="$elem/text()"/> ¬†<xsl:variable¬†name="setVals" ¬†¬†select="$elem/ancestor::crapp:crApp//crapp:setting//node()[local-name()=$elemName]"/> ¬†<xsl:value-of¬†select="functx:is-value-in-sequence($elemText, if($setVals/attribute::node()[local-name()=$attName])then($setVals/attribute::node()[local-name()=$attName]) else($setVals/crapp:label[@xml:lang=$lang]/text()))"/> </xsl:function> <xsl:function¬†name="crapp:valuesAllowed"> ¬†<xsl:param¬†name="elem"¬†as="node()"/> ¬†<xsl:param¬†name="attName"¬†as="xs:string"/> ¬†<xsl:variable¬†name="lang" ¬†¬†select="$elem/ancestor::crapp:setting/crapp:language/@codedval"/> ¬†<xsl:variable¬†name="elemName" ¬†¬†select="local-name($elem)"/> ¬†<xsl:variable¬†name="elemText" ¬†¬†select="$elem/text()"/> ¬†<xsl:variable¬†name="setVals" ¬†¬†select="$elem/ancestor::crapp:crApp//crapp:setting//node()[local-name()=$elemName]"/> ¬†<xsl:for-each¬†select="$setVals"> ¬†¬†<xsl:value-of¬†select="if(attribute::node()[local-name()=$attName]) then(attribute::node()[local-name()=$attName]/string()) else(text())"/> ¬†</xsl:for-each> </xsl:function> <xsl:function¬†name="crapp:valuesAllowedJoined"> ¬†<xsl:param¬†name="elem"¬†as="node()"/> ¬†<xsl:param¬†name="attName"¬†as="xs:string"/> ¬†<xsl:value-of¬†select="string-join(crapp:valuesAllowed($elem, $attName), ', ')"/> </xsl:function> <sch:pattern¬†abstract="true" ¬†id="checkValues"> ¬†<sch:rule¬†context="crapp:remark//node()[local-name()='$elementName']"> ¬†¬†<sch:assert¬†test="exists(ancestor::crapp:crApp/crapp:setting//node()[local-name()='$elementName'])" ¬†¬†¬†role="fatal">No setting for <sch:value-of¬†select="local-name(.)"/> defined. Please define the setting before use.</sch:assert> ¬†¬†<sch:report¬†test="exists(ancestor::crapp:crApp/crapp:setting//node()[local-name()='$elementName']) and crapp:checkValues(., '$attrStr') = false()" ¬†¬†¬†role="error">The value <sch:value-of¬†select="."/> is not allowed here. Please use one of these: <sch:value-of¬†select="crapp:valuesAllowedJoined(., '$attrStr')"/>.</sch:report> ¬†</sch:rule> </sch:pattern> </sch:schema>
Notes
1
Die Validierung der Z√§hlzeiten funktioniert derzeit nur in Werken, in denen die Taktart nicht wechselt, da keine weitere Werkstruktur erfasst wird.
‚Üµ
2
die Abbildung von Abh√§ngigkeiten zwischen Quellen (i.e. Stemma) ist nicht implementiert. Das Datenmodell geht diesbez√ºglich agnostisch vor.
‚Üµ
Home¬†Feedback¬†
Dennis Ried. Date: 2023-03-30
